amenity.description: amenity=*is thetop-level tagdescribing useful and important facilities for visitors and residents, such as toilets, telephones, banks, pharmacies, prisons and schools.

animal_boarding.description_en: A facility where you, paying a fee, can bring your animal for a limited period of time (e.g. for holidays)

animal_breeding.description_en: A facility where animals are bred, usually to sell them

animal_shelter.description_en: A shelter that recovers animals in trouble

animal_training.description_en: A facility used for non-competitive animal training

arts_centre.description_en: A venue where a variety of arts are performed or conducted
arts_centre.description_enriched: Centre culturel, maison des arts. Expositions, ateliers créatifs, cours de peinture, sculpture.

atm.description_en: Automated teller machine (ATM) or cashpoint: a device that provides the clients of a financial institution with access to financial transactions.
atm.description_enriched: Distributeur de billets, DAB. Retirer de l'argent, espèces, carte bancaire, cash.

baby_hatch.description_en: A place where a baby can be, out of necessity, anonymously left to be safely cared for and perhaps adopted.
baby_hatch.description_enriched: Boîte à bébé, tour d'abandon. Déposer un nourrisson anonymement en sécurité.

baking_oven.description_en: An oven used for baking bread and similar, for example inside abuilding=bakehouse.

bank.description_en: Bank or credit union: a financial establishment where customers can deposit and withdraw money, take loans, make investments and transfer funds.
bank.description_enriched: Agence bancaire. Ouvrir un compte, virement, crédit, conseiller, coffre, guichet.

bar.description_en: Baris a purpose-built commercial establishment that sells alcoholic drinks to be consumed on the premises. They are characterised by a noisy and vibrant atmosphere, similar to a party and usually don't sell food. See also the description of the tagsamenity=pub;bar;restaurantfor a distinction between
bar.description_enriched: Bar, débit de boissons. Boire un verre, cocktails, bière, apéro, comptoir, soirée.

bbq.description_en: BBQorBarbecueis a permanently built grill for cooking food, which is most typically used outdoors by the public. For example these may be found in city parks or at beaches. Use the tagfuel=*to specify the source of heating, such asfuel=wood;electric;charcoal. For mapping nearby table and chairs, see

bench.description_en: A bench to sit down and relax a bit
bench.description_enriched: Banc public. S'asseoir, se reposer, attendre, pause, mobilier urbain.

bicycle_parking.description_enriched: Parking vélo, arceaux. Garer son vélo, antivol, cadenas, stationnement cycliste.

bicycle_rental.description_enriched: Location de vélos. Vélib, vélos en libre-service, louer une bicyclette, VLS.

bicycle_repair_station.description_en: General tools for self-service bicycle repairs, usually on the roadside; no service
bicycle_repair_station.description_enriched: Station de réparation vélo. Pompe, outils, gonfler pneus, réparer crevaison.

biergarten.description_en: Biergartenorbeer gardenis an open-air area where alcoholic beverages along with food is prepared and served. See also the description of the tagsamenity=pub;bar;restaurant. A biergarten can commonly be found attached to a beer hall, pub, bar, or restaurant. In this case, you can usebiergarten=yesadd
biergarten.description_enriched: Jardin de bière allemand. Boire en terrasse, tables extérieures, ambiance conviviale.

brothel.description_en: An establishment specifically dedicated to prostitution
brothel.description_enriched: Maison close, bordel. Prostitution légale, travailleuses du sexe.

bureau_de_change.description_en: Bureau de change, money changer, currency exchange, Wechsel, cambio – a place to change foreign bank notes and travellers cheques.
bureau_de_change.description_enriched: Bureau de change. Échanger devises, euros, dollars, monnaie étrangère, taux.

bus_station.description_enriched: Gare routière. Prendre le car, bus longue distance, Flixbus, Blablacar Bus.

cafe.description_en: Cafeis generally an informal place that offers casual meals and beverages; typically, the focus is on coffee or tea. Also known as acoffeehouse/shop,bistroorsidewalk cafe. The kind of food served may be mapped with the tagscuisine=*anddiet:*=*. See also the tagsamenity=restaurant;bar;fast_food.
cafe.description_enriched: Café, salon de thé. Boire un café, thé, chocolat chaud, croissant, wifi, travailler.

canteen.description_enriched: Cantine, self-service. Déjeuner pas cher, repas collectif, plateau-repas, entreprise.

car_rental.description_enriched: Location de voitures. Louer une auto, Hertz, Avis, Europcar, véhicule de tourisme.

car_sharing.description_enriched: Autopartage. Voiture partagée, Citiz, Communauto, véhicule en libre-service.

car_wash.description_enriched: Station de lavage auto. Laver sa voiture, nettoyage, aspirateur, lustrage.

casino.description_en: A gambling venue with at least one table game(e.g. roulette, blackjack) that takes bets on sporting and other events at agreed upon odds.

charging_station.description_enriched: Borne de recharge électrique. Recharger voiture électrique, Tesla, prise, kWh.

check_in.description_en: Place where passengers can get their boarding passes before travel (typically found in airports).

childcare.description_enriched: Garderie, crèche. Faire garder ses enfants, nounou, assistante maternelle.

cinema.description_en: A place where films are shown (US: movie theater)
cinema.description_enriched: Cinéma, salle de films. Voir un film, séance, pop-corn, écran, blockbuster.

clinic.description_en: A medium-sized medical facility or health centre.
clinic.description_enriched: Clinique privée. Consultation médicale, chirurgie, hospitalisation courte.

clock.description_enriched: Horloge publique. Voir l'heure, horloge de gare, cadran, clocher.

college.description_en: Campus or buildings of an institute of Further Education (aka continuing education)
college.description_enriched: IUT, BTS, école supérieure. Études post-bac courtes, formation professionnelle.

community_centre.description_en: A place mostly used for local events, festivities and group activities; including special interest and special age groups. .
community_centre.description_enriched: Salle polyvalente, MJC. Activités, associations, fêtes, réunions quartier.

compressed_air.description_en: A device to inflate tires/tyres (e.g. motorcar, bicycle)
compressed_air.description_enriched: Station de gonflage. Gonfler pneus vélo ou voiture, air comprimé gratuit.

conference_centre.description_en: A large building that is used to hold a convention

courthouse.description_en: A building home to a court of law, where justice is dispensed
courthouse.description_enriched: Tribunal, palais de justice. Procès, audience, avocat, juge, affaires juridiques.

crematorium.description_en: A place where dead human bodies are burnt
crematorium.description_enriched: Crématorium. Crémation, cérémonie funéraire, cendres, urne.

dancing_school.description_en: A dancing school or dance studio

dentist.description_enriched: Cabinet dentaire. Soigner les dents, détartrage, carie, appareil dentaire, implant.

dive_centre.description_en: A dive center is the base location where sports divers usually start scuba diving or make dive guided trips at new locations.

doctors.description_enriched: Cabinet médical. Consulter un médecin, généraliste, ordonnance, arrêt maladie.

dog_toilet.description_en: Area designated for dogs to urinate and excrete.

drinking_water.description_en: Drinking wateris a place where humans can obtain potable water for consumption. Typically, the water is used for only drinking. Also known as adrinking fountainorbubbler.
drinking_water.description_enriched: Point d'eau potable. Boire, remplir sa gourde, fontaine, robinet public.

driver_training.description_en: A place for driving training on a closed course

driving_school.description_en: Driving School which offers motor vehicle driving lessons

events_venue.description_en: A building specifically used for organising events

fast_food.description_en: Fast food restaurant (see alsoamenity=restaurant). The kind of food served can be tagged withcuisine=*anddiet:*=*.
fast_food.description_enriched: Fast-food, restauration rapide. Burger, frites, kebab, sandwich, à emporter.

ferry_terminal.description_en: Ferry terminal/stop. A place where people/cars/etc. can board and leave a ferry.
ferry_terminal.description_enriched: Gare maritime, terminal ferry. Prendre le bateau, traversée, embarquement voiture.

fire_station.description_en: A station of a fire brigade
fire_station.description_enriched: Caserne de pompiers. Secours, incendie, 18, SDIS, intervention urgence.

first_aid_school.description_en: A place where people can go for first aid courses.

food_court.description_en: An area with several different restaurant food counters and a shared eating area. Commonly found in malls, airports, etc.
food_court.description_enriched: Aire de restauration. Plusieurs restaurants, centre commercial, choix de cuisines.

fountain.description_en: A fountain for cultural / decorational / recreational purposes.
fountain.description_enriched: Fontaine décorative. Jets d'eau, bassin, place publique, rafraîchissement.

fuel.description_en: Petrol station; gas station; marine fuel; … Streets to petrol stations are often taggedhighway=service.
fuel.description_enriched: Station-service, essence. Faire le plein, carburant, diesel, SP95, GPL, lavage.

funeral_hall.description_en: A place for holding a funeral ceremony, other than a place of worship.

gambling.description_en: A place for gambling, not being ashop=bookmaker,shop=lottery,amenity=casino, orleisure=adult_gaming_centre.Games that are covered by this definition include bingo and pachinko.

give_box.description_en: A small facility where people drop off and pick up various types of items in the sense of free sharing and reuse.

grave_yard.description_en: A (smaller) place of burial, often you'll find a church nearby. Large places should belanduse=cemeteryinstead.
grave_yard.description_enriched: Petit cimetière. Tombes, sépultures, se recueillir, fleurs, défunts.

grit_bin.description_en: A container that holds grit or a mixture of salt and grit.

hospital.description_en: A hospital providing in-patient medical treatment. Often used in conjunction withemergency=*to note whether the medical centre has emergency facilities (A&E (brit.) or ER (am.))
hospital.description_enriched: Hôpital, CHU. Urgences, opération, hospitalisation, soins intensifs, maternité.

hunting_stand.description_en: A hunting stand: an open or enclosed platform used by hunters to place themselves at an elevated height above the terrain

hydrant.description_en: Similar to afire_hydrant=*, but for gardening and other municipal purposes other than fire extinction

ice_cream.description_en: Ice cream shop or ice cream parlour. A place that sells ice cream and frozen yoghurt over the counter
ice_cream.description_enriched: Glacier. Glaces, sorbets, cornets, parfums, été, dessert frais.

internet_cafe.description_en: A place whose principal role is providing internet services to the public.
internet_cafe.description_enriched: Cybercafé. Ordinateurs publics, internet, imprimer, scanner, navigation web.

kindergarten.description_en: For children too young for a regular school (also known as preschool, playschool or nursery school), in some countries including afternoon supervision of primary school children.
kindergarten.description_enriched: École maternelle, crèche. Enfants 2-6 ans, éveil, jeux, sieste, goûter.

kitchen.description_en: A public kitchen in a facility to use by everyone or customers

kneipp_water_cure.description_en: Outdoor foot bath facility. Usually this is a pool with cold water and handrail. Popular in German speaking countries.

language_school.description_en: Language School: an educational institution where one studies a foreign language.
language_school.description_enriched: École de langues. Apprendre anglais, espagnol, cours de français, TOEFL.

library.description_en: A public library (municipal, university, …) to borrow books from.
library.description_enriched: Bibliothèque, médiathèque. Emprunter livres, lire, étudier, DVD, journaux, wifi.

lounge.description_en: A comfortable waiting area for customers, usually found in airports and other transportation hubs. Typically has extra amenities or sustenance.

lounger.description_en: An object for people to lie down.

love_hotel.description_en: A love hotel is a type of short-stay hotel operated primarily for the purpose of allowing guests privacy for sexual activities.

mailroom.description_en: A mailroom for receiving packages or letters.

marketplace.description_en: A marketplace where goods and services are traded daily or weekly.
marketplace.description_enriched: Marché, halle. Fruits, légumes, fromage, viande, produits frais, producteurs.

monastery.description_en: Monastery is the location of a monastery or a building in which monks and nuns live.

money_transfer.description_en: A place that offers money transfers, especially cash to cash

mortuary.description_en: A morgue or funeral home, used for the storage of human corpses.

motorcycle_parking.description_enriched: Parking moto. Garer sa moto, scooter, deux-roues motorisé.

music_school.description_en: A music school, an educational institution specialized in the study, training, and research of music.

music_venue.description_en: An indoor place to hear contemporary live music.

nightclub.description_en: A place to drink and dance (nightclub). The German word is "Disco" or "Discothek". Please don't confuse this with the German "Nachtclub" which is most likelyamenity=stripclub.

nursing_home.description_en: Discouraged tag for a home for disabled or elderly persons who need permanent care. Useamenity=social_facility+social_facility=nursing_homenow.
nursing_home.description_enriched: EHPAD, maison de retraite. Personnes âgées, soins, dépendance, résidence senior.

parcel_locker.description_en: Machine for picking up and sending parcels
parcel_locker.description_enriched: Casier à colis, point relais automatique. Récupérer colis Amazon, Cdiscount.

parking.description_en: Parking area for vehicles. Streets on car parking are often taggedhighway=serviceandservice=parking_aisle.
parking.description_enriched: Parking voiture. Garer sa voiture, place de stationnement, horodateur.

parking_entrance.description_en: An entrance or exit to an underground or multi-storey parking facility. Group multiple parking entrances together with a relation using the tagstype=siteandsite=parking

parking_space.description_en: A single parking space within a car park. Parking spaces should be mapped within anamenity=parkingarea. Group multiple parking spaces together with a relation using the tagstype=siteandsite=parking

payment_centre.description_en: A non-bank place, where people can pay bills of public and private services and taxes.

pharmacy.description_en: Pharmacy: a shop where a pharmacist sells medicationsdispensing=yes/no- availability of prescription-only medications
pharmacy.description_enriched: Pharmacie. Acheter médicaments, ordonnance, conseil santé, garde de nuit.

photo_booth.description_en: A stand to create instant photos.

place_of_mourning.description_en: A room or building where families and friends can come, before the funeral, and view the body of the person who has died.

place_of_worship.description_en: A church, mosque, or temple, etc. Note that you also needreligion=*, usuallydenomination=*and preferablyname=*as well asamenity=place_of_worship. Seethe articlefor details.
place_of_worship.description_enriched: Lieu de culte. Église, mosquée, synagogue, temple, prière, messe, office.

police.description_en: A police station where police officers patrol from and that is a first point of contact for civilians
police.description_enriched: Commissariat, gendarmerie. Porter plainte, déclarer vol, urgence 17, policiers.

post_box.description_en: A box for the reception of mail. Alternative mail-carriers can be tagged viaoperator=*
post_box.description_enriched: Boîte aux lettres. Poster courrier, envoyer lettre, levée, timbre.

post_depot.description_en: Post depot or delivery office, where letters and parcels are collected and sorted prior to delivery.

post_office.description_en: Post office building with postal services
post_office.description_enriched: Bureau de poste, La Poste. Envoyer colis, recommandé, retirer courrier, timbres.

prison.description_en: A prison or jail where people are incarcerated before trial or after conviction

pub.description_en: A place selling beer and other alcoholic drinks; may also provide food or accommodation (UK). See description ofamenity=barandamenity=pubfor distinction between bar and pub
pub.description_enriched: Pub, taverne. Bière pression, ambiance anglaise, sport TV, fish and chips.

public_bath.description_en: A location where the public may bathe in common, etc. japanese onsen, turkish bath, hot spring
public_bath.description_enriched: Bains publics, thermes. Hammam, sauna, bain chaud, détente, spa public.

public_bookcase.description_en: A street furniture containing books. Take one or leave one.
public_bookcase.description_enriched: Boîte à livres. Prendre ou déposer un livre gratuitement, échange, lecture.

public_building.description_en: A generic public building. Don't use! Seeoffice=government.
public_building.description_enriched: Bâtiment public. Administration, services municipaux, accueil citoyen.

ranger_station.description_en: National Park visitor headquarters: official park visitor facility with police, visitor information, permit services, etc

recycling.description_en: Recycling facilities (bottle banks, etc.). Combine withrecycling_type=containerfor containers orrecycling_type=centrefor recycling centres.
recycling.description_enriched: Point de tri, recyclage. Verre, papier, plastique, poubelles colorées, tri sélectif.

refugee_site.description_en: A human settlement sheltering refugees or internally displaced persons

research_institute.description_en: An establishment endowed for doing research.

restaurant.description_en: Restaurant (not fast food, seeamenity=fast_food). The kind of food served can be tagged withcuisine=*anddiet:*=*.
restaurant.description_enriched: Restaurant. Manger, déjeuner, dîner, menu, carte, serveur, réservation.

sanitary_dump_station.description_en: A place for depositing human waste from a toilet holding tank.

school.description_en: School and grounds - primary, middle and secondary schools
school.description_enriched: École primaire ou collège. Élèves, cours, récréation, cantine, devoirs.

shelter.description_en: A small shelter against bad weather conditions. To additionally describe the kind of shelter useshelter_type=*.
shelter.description_enriched: Abri, auvent. Se protéger pluie, abribus, refuge, attendre au sec.

shower.description_enriched: Douche publique. Se laver, plage, camping, sportifs, hygiène.

social_centre.description_en: A place for free and not-for-profit activities.

social_facility.description_en: A facility that provides social services: group & nursing homes, workshops for the disabled, homeless shelters, etc.
social_facility.description_enriched: Centre social, CCAS. Aide sociale, insertion, accompagnement, RSA.

stripclub.description_en: A place that offers striptease or lapdancing (for sexual services useamenity=brothel).

studio.description_enriched: Studio radio ou TV. Enregistrement, émission, podcast, tournage.

surf_school.description_en: A surf school is an establishment that teaches surfing.

swingerclub.description_en: A club where people meet to have a party and group sex.

taxi.description_en: A place where taxis wait for passengers.
taxi.description_enriched: Station de taxi. Prendre un taxi, VTC, chauffeur, course, taximètre.

telephone.description_enriched: Téléphone public, cabine. Appeler, urgences, dépannage, pièces ou carte.

theatre.description_en: A theatre or opera house where live performances occur, such as plays, musicals and formal concerts. Useamenity=cinemafor movie theaters.
theatre.description_enriched: Théâtre. Pièce, spectacle, comédie, tragédie, acteurs, scène, représentation.

toilets.description_enriched: Toilettes publiques, WC. Faire pipi, sanitaires, papier, gratuit ou payant.

townhall.description_en: Building where the administration of a village, town or city may be located, or just a community meeting place
townhall.description_enriched: Mairie, hôtel de ville. État civil, mariage, élections, carte d'identité, maire.

toy_library.description_en: A place to borrow games and toys, or play with them on site.

training.description_en: Public place where you can get training.

university.description_en: A university campus: an institute of higher education
university.description_enriched: Université, fac. Études supérieures, licence, master, campus, étudiants, cours.

vending_machine.description_en: A machine selling goods – food, tickets, newspapers, etc. Add type of goods usingvending=*
vending_machine.description_enriched: Distributeur automatique. Acheter snacks, boissons, 24h/24, pièces.

veterinary.description_en: A place where a veterinary surgeon, also known as a veterinarian or vet, practices.
veterinary.description_enriched: Vétérinaire. Soigner chien, chat, vaccins animal, urgences, stérilisation.

waste_basket.description_en: A single small container for depositing garbage that is easily accessible for pedestrians.
waste_basket.description_enriched: Poubelle publique. Jeter déchets, corbeille, propreté urbaine.

waste_disposal.description_en: A medium or large disposal bin, typically for bagged up household or industrial waste.
waste_disposal.description_enriched: Benne à ordures. Conteneur poubelle immeuble, déchets ménagers.

waste_transfer_station.description_en: A waste transfer station is a location that accepts, consolidates and transfers waste in bulk.
waste_transfer_station.description_enriched: Déchetterie, recyclerie. Déposer encombrants, tri, récupération objets.

water_point.description_en: Place where you can get large amounts of drinking water

watering_place.description_en: Place where water is contained and animals can drink

weighbridge.description_en: A large weight scale to weigh vehicles and goods

shop.description: shop=*is used to mark the location of ashop— a place selling retail products or services.

agrarian.description_en: Shop focused on selling agrarian products, like seeds, agricultural machinery, animal feed, etc.
agrarian.description_fr: Vente de fournitures et matériel agricole.s
agrarian.description_enriched: Coopérative agricole. Semences, engrais, matériel ferme.

alcohol.description_en: Shop selling alcohol to take away

anime.description_en: Shop focused on selling anime stuff.
anime.description_enriched: Boutique manga anime. Figurines, DVD, Japon, cosplay.

antiques.description_enriched: Antiquaire. Meubles anciens, objets collection, brocante.

appliance.description_en: Shop focused on selling large electrical items (aka white goods) washing machines, fridges, cookers, ovens, fans, etc.

art.description_en: Shop which sells works of art. May be paintings, sculpture, or other types of art
art.description_enriched: Galerie d'art. Tableaux, sculptures, acheter œuvre.

atv.description_en: Shop focused on sellingatvs(quads), atv equipment and may rent or repair them

baby_goods.description_en: Shop focused on selling objects for babies (clothes, prams, cots, toys).

bathroom_furnishing.description_en: Shop focused on selling bathroom furniture and accessories

beauty.description_en: A non-hairdresser beauty shop, spa, nail salon, etc.. See alsoshop=hairdresser.
beauty.description_enriched: Institut beauté. Soins visage, épilation, manucure.

bed.description_en: Shop focused on selling beds, mattresses and other bedding products.
bed.description_enriched: Magasin literie. Matelas, sommier, oreillers, draps.

beverages.description_en: Shop focused on selling alcoholic and non-alcoholic beverages. See alsoshop=alcohol.

bicycle.description_en: Shop focused on selling bicycles, bicycle equipment and may rent or repair them

boat.description_en: Shop focused on selling boats, boat equipment and may rent or repair them

bookmaker.description_en: A shop that takes bets on sporting and other events at agreed upon odds.

books.description_en: Shop focused on selling books (for a library that lends books, seeamenity=library)

boutique.description_en: A small shopping outlet, especially one that specializes in elite and fashionable items. This is deprecated, please useshop=clothes

brewing_supplies.description_en: Shop focused on selling supplies for home brewing of beer, wine and spirits (where permitted).

camera.description_en: A shop mainly selling cameras and lenses

candles.description_en: Shop focused on selling candles and candle accessories (holders, etc)

cannabis.description_en: a shop primarily and legally selling non-medical cannabis products

car.description_en: Car store – a place primarily to buy cars or to additionally get your car repaired

car_parts.description_en: Shop focused on selling auto parts, auto accessories, motor oil, car chemicals, etc.

caravan.description_en: A shop for caravans, motorhomes & similar recreational vehicles.

charity.description_en: A charity shop is a shop operated by a charity, for the purposes of fundraising.

chemist.description_en: Shop focused on selling articles of personal hygiene, cosmetics, and household cleaning products (for a shop that potentially dispenses prescription drugs, cf. pharmacy. U.S. drug store, seeamenity=pharmacy)

clothes.description_en: Shop focused on selling clothes and/or underwear

collector.description_en: A shop for different collector's items like stamps, coins, action figures, etc.

computer.description_en: Shop focused on selling computers, peripherals, software, …

confectionery.description_en: Shop focused on selling sweets or candy

convenience.description_en: A small local shop carrying a small subset of the items you would find in a supermarket

copyshop.description_en: Shop focused on selling photocopying and printing services.

country_store.description_en: Shop focused on selling rural supplies – a range of goods specifically aimed at country dwellers

craft.description_en: An arts and crafts supply store. Commonly sold items are paper, canvas, paint, pencils, crafting wood, crafting tools, etc. – look atcraft=*

curtain.description_en: Shop focused on selling curtains or drapes (see alsoshop=fabric)

dairy.description_en: Shop focused on selling dairy products.

deli.description_en: Shop focused on sellingdelicatessen(fine foods, gourmet foods), possibly also fine wine. Not to be confused with the US delis.
deli.description_enriched: Épicerie fine. Traiteur, produits luxe, gastronomie.

department_store.description_en: A single large store – often multiple storeys high – selling a large variety of goods (see alsoshop=mall)

doityourself.description_en: Shop focused on selling tools and supplies to do-it-yourself householders, gardening, …
doityourself.description_enriched: Bricolage. Leroy Merlin, Castorama, outils, matériaux.

dry_cleaning.description_en: Shop or kiosk offering a clothes dry cleaning service. The actual cleaning may be done elsewhere.
dry_cleaning.description_enriched: Pressing. Nettoyage à sec, repassage, costumes.

e-cigarette.description_en: Shop focused on selling electronic cigarettes.

electrical.description_en: Shop focused on selling electrical supplies and devices
electrical.description_fr: Vente de fournitures et d'appareils électriques

electronics.description_en: Shop focused on selling consumer electronics (TV, radio, …). Larger ones may also sell computers, fridges, …

erotic.description_en: Shop focused on selling erotic toys, -clothes or other erotic stuff.

estate_agent.description_enriched: Agent immobilier. Acheter, vendre, louer maison.

fabric.description_en: Shop focused on selling fabric and other materials for the purpose of making clothes and other products, eg dress making.

farm.description_en: Shop or roadside stand focused on selling freshly harvested farm produce
farm.description_enriched: Vente directe ferme. Producteur, légumes, œufs, local.

fashion.description_en: Shop focused on selling fashion. This is deprecated, please useshop=clothes.

fashion_accessories.description_en: Shop focused on selling fashion accessories.

fireplace.description_en: Shop focused on selling electric fireplaces, stoves or masonry heaters and required fuels

fishing.description_en: Shop focused on selling fishing equipment.

florist.description_en: Shop focused on selling bouquets of flowers (seeshop=garden_centrefor potted flowers).

food.description_en: Shop focused on selling food, more specific value should be used if possible.shop=food+food=prepared_mealswas also proposed/used for type of shop selling prepared meals, not ready for eating immediately (and requiring for example heating/boiling or other simple preparation).

frozen_food.description_en: Shop focused on selling frozen food.

fuel.description_en: Shop selling fuels (motor fuel, wood, coal, gas) that can't be considered aamenity=fuel(fuel station). Usefuel:*=yes/no to indicate which fuels are available.

funeral_directors.description_en: Providing services related to funeral arrangements, may also be known as a "funeral parlour" or "undertakers".

furniture.description_en: Shop focused on selling furniture, might range from small decorational items to a whole flat interior

games.description_en: Shop focused on selling board games, card games and/or role-playing games.

garden_centre.description_en: Shop focused on selling potted flowers, maybe even trees (see alsoshop=floristfor flower bouquets).

garden_furniture.description_en: Shop focused on selling garden furniture (sheds, outdoor tables, gates, fences, ...). Seeshop=garden_centreif also plants are sold.

gas.description_en: Shop focused on selling technical gas, such as argon, oxygen, acetylene, nitrogen, carbon dioxide, etc. in pressurized containers

general.description_en: A store that carries a general line of merchandise. (see alsoshop=convenienceif it sells food).

gift.description_en: Shop focused on selling gifts, greeting cards, or tourist gifts (souvenirs)

glaziery.description_en: Shop focused on selling and installing glazing for windows and doors.

golf.description_en: Shop focused on selling golf equipment.

greengrocer.description_en: Shop focused on selling vegetables and fruits.

groundskeeping.description_en: Shop focused on selling outdoor groundskeeping equipment (lawnmowers, chainsaws, small tractors, ...

hairdresser.description_en: Here you can get your hair cut, coloured, … See alsoshop=beauty

hairdresser_supply.description_en: A shop, where you can buy hairdressing supplies.

hardware.description_en: Shop focused on selling building supplies including screws, bolts & paints, … See alsoshop=doityourself

health_food.description_en: A health food shop; selling wholefoods, vitamins, nutrition supplements and meat and dairy alternatives.
health_food.description_fr: Magasin d'aliments de santé et diététiques

hearing_aids.description_en: Shop focused on selling hearing aids devices

herbalist.description_en: Shop focused on selling herbs, often for medical purposes. (See also:healthcare:speciality=herbalismandhealthcare=alternative).

hifi.description_en: Shop focused on selling High Fidelity or High End environment to listen music or watch films at home

household_linen.description_en: Shop focused on selling household linen.

houseware.description_en: Shop focused on selling crockery, cutlery, kitchenware, small household appliances.

hunting.description_en: Shop focused on selling gun and hunting equipment.

ice_cream.description_en: Shop selling ice cream. See alsoamenity=ice_cream.

interior_decoration.description_en: Shop focused on selling interior decorations.

kiosk.description_en: A small shop on the pavement that sells magazines, tobacco, newspapers, sweets and stamps.
kiosk.description_enriched: Kiosque. Journaux, tabac, bonbons, petit commerce.

kitchen.description_en: A shop where you can plan and buy your kitchen. (Sometimes called "kitchen studio" and the like, but plain kitchen is the most frequently used tag so far.)

laundry.description_en: A shop to get your normal clothes washed. Might be self service coin operated, with service staff for drop off, …

leather.description_en: Shop focused on selling products made out of leather.
leather.description_fr: Vente de vêtements en cuir / Maroquinerie

lighting.description_en: A shop selling lighting fixtures and lamps.

locksmith.description_en: Shop focused on selling keys, see alsocraft=locksmithandcraft=key_cutter

lottery.description_en: A shop of which the main or only purpose is the sale of lottery tickets.

mall.description_en: A shopping mall – multiple stores under one roof (also known as a shopping centre)

medical_supply.description_en: Shop focused on selling medical supplies.

mobile_phone.description_en: Shop focused on selling mobile phones and accessories

model.description_en: Shop specialising in the sale of scale models.

money_lender.description_en: A money lender offers small personal loans at high rates of interest.

motorcycle.description_en: Shop focused on selling motorcycles and/or related accessories, clothes, parts, and rental services.

music.description_en: Shop focused on selling recorded music (vinyl/CDs/...)

musical_instrument.description_en: Shop focused on selling musical instruments, lyrics, scores. If focused on a specific instrument, specify with musical_instrument=*

newsagent.description_en: Shop focused on selling newspapers, cigarettes, other goods
newsagent.description_fr: Maison de la presse / Kiosque à journaux

nutrition_supplements.description_en: Shops that sells one or more nutritional supplements (of vitamins, minerals and/or herbs)

nuts.description_en: Shop selling dried nuts/fruits, edible seeds, etc. Not to be confused withshop=spices.

optician.description_en: Shop focused on selling eyeglasses, contact lenses (may also check your eyes).

outdoor.description_en: Shop focused on selling camping, walking, climbing, and other outdoor sports equipment (GPSes, etc.)
outdoor.description_enriched: Outdoor. Randonnée, camping, montagne, sport nature.

outpost.description_en: Shop primarily used to pick-up items ordered online.

party.description_en: A shop for party and festival supplies, like costumes, etc.

pasta.description_en: Shop focused on selling (fresh) pasta, ravioli, etc.

pastry.description_en: Shop focused on selling baked sweets like cakes, biscuits, strudel and pies.

pawnbroker.description_en: A pawnbroker (or pawnshop) is an individual or business that offers secured loans to people. See alsoshop=second_hand

pest_control.description_en: Shop selling pest control goods to exterminate rats, insects etc.

pet.description_en: A shop for pets, animals and toys or food for them.

pet_grooming.description_en: A shop offering grooming services for pets (most frequently dogs)

photo.description_en: Shop focused on selling products or services related with photography.

pottery.description_en: Shop focused on selling earthenware, stoneware and porcelain and other ceramic ware.

printer_ink.description_en: A shop that sells or refills printer ink cartridges.

pyrotechnics.description_en: Store of pyrotechnics: fireworks, firecrackers, sparklers etc.

radiotechnics.description_en: Shop focused on selling electronic components, electrical products, radio measuring devices, supplies for radio and electronics.

religion.description_en: Shop focused on selling religious articles, church shop. See alsoreligion=*

rental.description_en: Shop that rents different kinds of vehicles or (sport) equipment

scooter.description_en: Shop focused on selling scooters (small 2 wheeled, low platformed motorcycles).

scuba_diving.description_en: Shop focused on selling scuba diving equipment.

seafood.description_enriched: Fruits de mer. Huîtres, moules, crustacés.

second_hand.description_en: A shop buying and selling used clothes and other things. See alsoshop=pawnbroker

security.description_en: Shop focused on selling security items like burglar alarms, vaults, locking systems, video surveillance cameras, firefighting equipment, alarm systems, warning systems, etc.

sewing.description_en: A shop that sells sewing supplies (fabric, thread, yarn, knitting needles, sewing machines, etc.)

ski.description_en: Shop focused on selling skis, ski equipment and may rent or repair them

snowmobile.description_en: Shop focused on selling snowmobiles, snowmobile equipment and may rent or repair them

sports.description_en: Shop focused on selling sporting goods.

stationery.description_en: Shop focused on selling office supplies

supermarket.description_en: Supermarket – a large store with groceries and other items

surf.description_en: Shop selling surfboards, sailboards, wakeboards, and other types of surf style boards. and/or related accessories, clothes, parts, repair and rental services.

swimming_pool.description_en: A store that sells swimming pool equipment and supplies.

tailor.description_en: A place where clothing is made, repaired, or altered professionally, especially suits and men's clothing

tea.description_enriched: Salon de thé, boutique thé. Thés, infusions.

telecommunication.description_en: Shop selling internet, television or similar services, and related hardware.

ticket.description_en: Shop focused on selling tickets for concerts, events, public transport, …

tobacco.description_en: Shop focused on selling tobacco, cigarettes and their related accessories. Often called a "smoke shop".
tobacco.description_enriched: Bureau de tabac. Cigarettes, jeux, timbres.

trade.description_en: A place of business that sells to a particular trade or trades, but normally also retails to normal consumers. See alsoshop=doityourself

trailer.description_en: Shop focused on selling trailers and parts and/or repairing / renting them

travel_agency.description_en: Shop focused on selling tickets for travelling. Also known as a tour operator.

trophy.description_en: Store selling trophies, awards, plaques etc.

truck.description_en: Shop focused on selling trucks and other commercial vehicles

vacant.description_en: An unused vacant shop. Can be used for an empty or abandoned retail space that seems to be available for lease or purchase where a retail store (or similar businesses) may be opened. No store is being operated in a vacant shop, and neither goods nor services are being offered. This tag can be used a
vacant.description_enriched: Local vacant. À louer, fermé, disponible.

vacuum_cleaner.description_en: Shop focused on selling vacuum cleaners and associated products.

variety_store.description_en: A variety store retailer is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, sometimes with a single price point for all items in the store.
variety_store.description_enriched: Bazar, discount. Tout à un euro, Gifi.

vending_machine.description_en: Shop with multiple vending machines in a room, usually without employees

video.description_en: Shop focused on selling or renting out videos/DVDs.

video_games.description_en: Shop focused on selling video games.

water.description_en: Shop focused on selling drinking water.

weapons.description_en: Shop focused on selling weapons like knives, guns etc.

wholesale.description_en: Wholesale/warehouse club or cash and carry – a store that sells items in bulk to retailers. The branch of industry can be defined withwholesale=*.

window_blind.description_en: Shop focused on selling window blinds.

wine.description_enriched: Cave à vins. Vins, champagne, dégustation.

wool.description_en: Shop selling wool for making of clothes or other products.

yes.description_en: A shop of unspecified type – it is always better to use another value that gives info about shop type, if possible. Used also as indicator that feature such as fuel station has a shop.

tourism.description: Thetourism=*key marks places and things of specific interest to tourists, for purposes of sightseeing, accommodation, information and support. Tourism features can be represented using either a node o

alpine_hut.description_en: Analpine hutor amountain hutis a remote building positioned in the mountains designed to provided lodging accommodation for mountaineers, climbers and hikers. The access is usually restricted to foot, mountain bike or ski. Typically, these are operated by anAlpine Clubor a similar organisation.
alpine_hut.description_enriched: Refuge de montagne. Dormir altitude, randonnée, gardé.

apartment.description_en: A holiday or vacation apartment is a furnished apartment or flat with cooking and bathroom facilities that can be rented for holiday vacations. This tag can be applied to a building accommodating one or more holiday flats.

aquarium.description_en: Apublic aquariumis the aquatic counterpart of a zoo with living aquatic animals for public viewing.

artwork.description_en: Apublic artworkis a piece of art on permanent public display, such as a sculpture, relief or mural. Typically, these are placed outdoors.
artwork.description_enriched: Œuvre d'art publique. Sculpture, fresque, installation.

attraction.description_en: Atourist attractionis a general place of interest for visitors, typically for its natural or historical significance. This tag is often used in combination with other tags such ashistoric=*,building=*,amenity=*.

camp_pitch.description_en: Acamp pitchis a free space used to place a tent or a caravan within atourism=camp_siteortourism=caravan_sitearea.

camp_site.description_en: Acampsiteorcamp groundis an area where people can temporarily use a shelter, such as a tent, camper van or sometimes a caravan. Typically, the area is split into "pitches" or "sites".

caravan_site.description_en: Acaravan site,caravan parkorRV parkis an area where people with caravans, motorhomes, recreational vehicles can stay overnight, or longer, in allotted spaces known as "pitches" or "sites". They usually provide facilities including toilets, waste disposal, water supply and power supply.

chalet.description_en: Achaletis an accommodation in form of one or more detached cottages with self-contained cooking facilities and/or bathroom and toilet facilities.

gallery.description_en: Anart galleryorart museumis a building or a room that displays a variety of exhibitions of visual art, such as paintings, sculptures or photography. This is not to be confused withtourism=museum.

guest_house.description_en: Guest housesprovide lodging accommodation that is typically owner-operated and without a hotel license. They usually offer private rooms served with breakfast, and are frequently referred to asbed and breakfast.
guest_house.description_enriched: Chambre d'hôtes. B&B, chez l'habitant, petit-déjeuner.

hostel.description_en: Hostelsprovide inexpensive accommodation, typically with them having shared bedrooms, bathrooms, kitchens, and lounges.
hostel.description_enriched: Auberge de jeunesse. Dortoir, pas cher, voyageurs.

hotel.description_en: Hotelsprovide accommodation in rooms or suites, typically for 2-5 people. Room facilities provided include a bed, clothing storage and bathrooms, while additional guest facilities may include restaurant, fitness, childcare and conference facilities.

information.description_en: features related to the information of tourists, like tourist information centres, guideposts, maps. Should be further described with the taginformation=*.
information.description_enriched: Point info tourisme. Renseignements, cartes, brochures.

motel.description_en: Amotel, originally an abbreviation of "motor hotel", is an establishment that provides accommodation designed for motorists on a short-term basis, with convenient parking for motor cars at or close to the room.

museum.description_en: Amuseumis an institution which has exhibitions on scientific, historical, artistic, or cultural artifacts. Typically these are open to the public as a tourist attraction.
museum.description_enriched: Musée. Expositions, collections, histoire, art, visite.

picnic_site.description_en: Apicnic siteis an area that is suitable for eating outdoors and has facilities for daily leisure activities such as water taps, toilets, barbecue grills, (picnic tables) and shelters for bad weather.
picnic_site.description_enriched: Aire de pique-nique. Tables, manger dehors, pause.

theme_park.description_en: Atheme parkoramusement parkis an area where entertainment is provided by rides, game concessions, etc., catering to large numbers to people. For example:Disneyland,Magic Kingdom,Universal Studios Florida,Europa Park, andOcean Park.

trail_riding_station.description_en: Atrail riding stationoffers temporary accommodation for guest horses and usually also for riders.

viewpoint.description_en: Aviewpoint, also known as anoverlook,observation point,lookout,viewing point,scenic areaorvista pointis a place with a good scenery view of the surrounding countryside or notable buildings.
viewpoint.description_enriched: Point de vue. Panorama, vue, photo, belvédère.

wilderness_hut.description_en: Awilderness hutorbackcountry hutis a remote building, with generally a fireplace, intended to provide temporary shelter and sleeping accommodation. See alsoBothy
wilderness_hut.description_fr: Refuge non gardé / Abri de bivouac
wilderness_hut.description_enriched: Refuge non gardé. Bivouac, montagne, autonome.

yes.description_en: To add tourist interest to something described by other tags.

zoo.description_en: AZoois an abbreviation for azoological gardenorparkthat has confined animals on display for viewing by the public.
zoo.description_enriched: Zoo. Animaux, safari, parc animalier, visiter.

leisure.description: Theleisure=*key generally denotes places where people go in their spare time ― for sport, recreation, relaxation or entertainment. See alsosport=*andtourism=*.

adult_gaming_centre.description_en: A venue with gambling machines and other pay-to-play games.Witha set age limit, as opposed toleisure=amusement_arcade.
adult_gaming_centre.description_enriched: Salle de jeux adultes. Machines sous, casino.

amusement_arcade.description_en: A venue with pay-to-play games, such as video games, driving simulators, pinball machines, merchandisers, etc.Withouta set age limit, as opposed toleisure=adult_gaming_centre.
amusement_arcade.description_enriched: Salle d'arcade. Bornes jeux vidéo, flipper, air hockey.

bandstand.description_en: An open structure where musical bands can perform concerts.

bathing_place.description_en: Public place where you can freely bath in nature.

beach_resort.description_en: To mark the boundary of a managed beach.

bleachers.description_en: Raised, tiered rows of benches found at spectator events

bowling_alley.description_en: A facility that is equipped to play the game of bowling.

dance.description_enriched: Salle de danse. Cours, bal, danse de salon.

dog_park.description_en: Designated area, with or without a fenced boundary, where dog-owners are permitted to exercise their pets unrestrained.

fishing.description_enriched: Zone de pêche. Pêcher, poissons, canne, étang.

healthcare=blood_bank.description_en: Blood bank, a facility where donated blood is stored

healthcare=blood_donation.description_en: A facility where you can donate blood, plasma and/or platelets, and possibly have stem cell samples taken

healthcare=centre.description_en: Healthcare facility with unspecified characteristics. Using this tag without further specifications is discouraged.

healthcare=clinic.description_en: May be used in addition toamenity=clinic

healthcare=community_health_worker.description_en: A place where acommunity health workerserves as the main health care provider

healthcare=counselling.description_en: Healthcare counselling, e.g. an addiction centre, a nutritionist, or a sex therapist. Also seehealthcare=nutrition_counselling.

healthcare=dentist.description_en: May be used in addition toamenity=dentist

healthcare=dialysis.description_en: A clinic for day patients to getkidney dialysistreatment

healthcare=doctor.description_en: May be used in addition toamenity=doctors

healthcare=hospice.description_en: A hospice which provides palliative care to terminally ill people and support to their relatives

healthcare=hospital.description_en: May be used in addition toamenity=hospital

healthcare=laboratory.description_en: Medical laboratory(also called analytical, diagnostic) is a place that analyzes body fluids such as blood, urine, faeces etc. Often blood and other samples are collected here as well.

healthcare=midwife.description_en: Amidwife, a health professional who cares for mothers and newborns around childbirth

healthcare=nurse.description_en: A facility where somenursesmay receive their patients

healthcare=occupational_therapist.description_en: Someone who practicesoccupational therapybut is not aphysician

healthcare=optometrist.description_en: Optometrist(eye doctor). If linked with a shop please useshop=opticianinstead.

healthcare=pharmacy.description_en: May be used in addition toamenity=pharmacy

healthcare=physiotherapist.description_en: Someone who practicesphysical therapy(also known askinesiotherapyin some countries) but is not aphysician

healthcare=podiatrist.description_en: Someone who practicespodiatrybut is not aphysician

healthcare=postpartum_care.description_en: A facility that helps residents recover from their childbirth (i.e.postpartum confinement).

healthcare=psychotherapist.description_en: Someone who practicespsychotherapybut is not aphysician

healthcare=rehabilitation.description_en: Medical rehabilitation facility; should not be used for a wellness clinic or hotel

healthcare=sample_collection.description_en: Site or dedicated healthcare facility where samples of blood/urine/etc are obtained or collected for purpose of analyzing them for healthcare diagnostics

healthcare=speech_therapist.description_en: Someone who practicesspeech and language therapy

healthcare=vaccination_centre.description_en: A healthcare facility specifically dedicated to administering vaccinations to individuals, to provide immunisation against infectious diseases

healthcare=yes.description_en: General healthcare facility. Used onlyif specifics are unknown. If this value is used, it is recommended to include some details with thedescription=*orfixme=*key.

laboratory.description_enriched: Laboratoire analyses. Prise de sang, résultats, biologie.

emergency.description: emergency=*is used in multiple ways, all related to emergency services, and facilities and amenities related to emergency and disaster response.

access_point.description_enriched: Point d'accès urgence. Pompiers, intervention forêt.

defibrillator.description_enriched: Défibrillateur DAE. Arrêt cardiaque, choc électrique, sauver vie.

fire_hydrant.description_enriched: Bouche incendie. Eau pompiers, poteau, borne.

lifeguard.description_enriched: Poste de secours plage. Sauveteurs, noyade, baignade.

phone.description_enriched: Téléphone urgence. Appeler secours, borne SOS.

historic.description: Thehistoric=*key is used to tag features thatstill existor of which traces are observable, and that are of historic interest, or where the feature class is generally of historical interest (e.g. waysi

aqueduct.description_enriched: Aqueduc. Romain, eau, pont, canaux anciens.

battlefield.description_enriched: Champ de bataille. Guerre, histoire, mémoire.

boundary_stone.description_enriched: Borne frontière. Pierre limite, ancien territoire.

castle.description_enriched: Château. Forteresse, donjon, tours, médiéval, visiter.

city_gate.description_enriched: Porte de ville. Remparts, entrée historique, fortification.

farm.description_enriched: Ferme historique. Agriculture ancienne, patrimoine rural.

industrial.description_enriched: Site industriel historique. Usine ancienne, patrimoine.

locomotive.description_enriched: Locomotive historique. Train ancien, vapeur, musée.

milestone.description_enriched: Borne kilométrique ancienne. Pierre, distance, route.

mine.description_enriched: Mine historique. Extraction, charbon, métaux, souterrain.

railway_car.description_enriched: Wagon historique. Train ancien, musée ferroviaire.

tomb.description_enriched: Tombe historique. Sépulture ancienne, personnage célèbre.

tower.description_enriched: Tour historique. Donjon, beffroi, guet, patrimoine.

wayside_chapel.description_enriched: Chapelle de chemin. Oratoire, prière, campagne.

wayside_cross.description_enriched: Croix de chemin. Calvaire, christianisme, campagne.

wayside_shrine.description_enriched: Oratoire de chemin. Niche, statue, dévotion.

wreck.description_enriched: Épave. Bateau coulé, plongée, archéologie sous-marine.

man_made.description: man_made=*is used to identify man-made(artificial)structures added to the landscape.

adit.description_en: A type of entrance to an underground mine which is horizontal or nearly horizontal.

antenna.description_en: An antenna to transmit and/or receive wireless signals.

avalanche_protection.description_en: A feature to protect from avalanches or to keep them from going off.

beacon.description_en: A structure for signalling on land and sea.

borehole.description_en: A bore used for a purpose not covered byman_made=petroleum_wellorman_made=water_well.

breakwater.description_en: A man-made structure designed to protect a shore or harbour from the sea and waves.

bridge.description_en: The outline of a bridge, grouping together all features for that bridge.Please also addbridge=*andlayer=*to all ways running over the bridge.

bunker_silo.description_en: An open-sided structure that can be used with vehicles to fill and empty them.

cairn.description_en: A mound of stones, usually conical or pyramidal, raised as a landmark or to designate a point of importance in surveying.

carpet_hanger.description_en: A construction to hang carpets for cleaning with the help of carpet beaters.

cellar_entrance.description_en: An entrance into artificially created vault.

charge_point.description_en: A device for charging electric vehicles.

chiller.description_en: industrial cooling construction with large diameter fans

chimney.description_en: A tall distinctive vertical conduit for venting hot gases or smoke, normally found near power stations or large factories.

clarifier.description_en: A clarifier of a wastewater treatment plant.

clearcut.description_en: An area where all trees have been uniformly cut down.

column.description_en: A column used to support a structure or for decoration.

communications_tower.description_en: A huge tower for transmitting radio applications.

compass_rose.description_en: A compass rose or wind rose.

compressor.description_en: Industrial equipment used to compress a gas by reducing its volume.

courtyard.description_en: An area that is usually enclosed by walls or buildings.

cross.description_en: Cross with little historical or religion value, e.g. summit cross.

cutline.description_en: A straight line cut in a forest.

dolphin.description_en: A marine structure for berthing and mooring of vessels.

dovecote.description_en: A place where doves are farmed or stored.

dyke.description_en: A dyke is a an embankment built to restrict the flow of water or other liquids.

flagpole.description_en: A long pole built to hold a flag.

flare.description_en: A tower constructed to burn off excess gas.

footwear_decontamination.description_en: A facility to decontaminate footwear for hikers.

frost_fan.description_en: A device to stop frosts from damaging crops.

fuel_pump.description_en: A fuel pump (petrol pump, gas pump)

gantry.description_en: An overhead structure across a major road usually for holding signs, often variable-message signs.

gasometer.description_en: A large container in which natural gas or town gas is stored near atmospheric pressure at ambient temperatures.

geoglyph.description_en: A large design or motif (generally longer than 4 metres) produced on the ground

goods_conveyor.description_en: A conveyor system for transporting materials

groyne.description_en: A rigid structure built from a shoreline or riverbank that interrupts water flow and limits the movement of sediment. See also:man_made=breakwater.

guard_stone.description_en: A guard stone: a stone built onto or into the corner of a building or wall to prevent carriages from damaging the structure, often found on either side of an entrance to a laneway, or alongside a wall to protect it.

guy_wire.description_en: Guy wire designed to add stability to a freestanding structure.

hongsalmun.description_en: A gate for entering a sacred place in Korea. The gate indicates entry to a sacred realm.

iljumun.description_en: The first gate at the entrance to many Korean Buddhist temples

insect_hotel.description_en: A structure intended to provide shelter for insects.

kiln.description_en: A kiln: an oven used for industrial processes such as hardening, drying, or smelting

lighthouse.description_en: Tower that emits light to serve as a navigational aid at sea or on inland waterway.

manhole.description_en: Hole with a cover that allows access to an underground service location, just large enough for a human to climb through.

mast.description_en: A mast is a vertical structure built to hold, for example, antennas.

maypole.description_en: A tall wooden pole erected as a part of various European folk traditions to celebrate the beginning of summer.

milk_churn_stand.description_en: A current or former collection point for milk churns.

mineshaft.description_en: A mineshaft: vertical tunnel into a mine where minerals are extracted.
mineshaft.description_enriched: Puits de mine. Descente souterrain, extraction.

monitoring_station.description_enriched: Station de mesure. Météo, pollution, surveillance.

nesting_site.description_en: A man made nesting aid that is mounted on a support device.

obelisk.description_en: Tall, narrow, four-sided, tapered monument which usually ends in a pyramid-like shape at the top.

observatory.description_en: Observatory: a location used for observing terrestrial or celestial events

offshore_platform.description_en: Offshore platform, oil platform or offshore drilling rig

oil_gas_separator.description_en: Industrial equipment used to separate liquid and gaseous components (oil and gas) produced from a petroleum well.

oxidation_ditch.description_en: An oxidation ditch of a wastewater treatment plant.

paifang.description_en: A traditional style of Chinese architectural arch or gateway structure.

petroleum_well.description_en: Oil well: a hole bored in the earth, designed to bring petroleum oil or gas to the surface

pier.description_en: A pier is a raised walkway over water, supported by widely spread piles or pillars.

pipeline.description_en: A major pipeline carrying gas, water, oil, etc.

planter.description_en: A structure for planting flowers or other ornamental plants.

pump.description_en: A device in charge of moving or raising the level of liquids.

pumping_rig.description_en: A pumping rig for producing oil. Use of this tag is discouraged. Seeman_made=petroleum_wellinstead.

pumping_station.description_en: Pumping station: a facility including pumps and equipment for pumping fluids from one place to another

quay.description_en: A man-made structure alongside navigable water used for loading and unloading vessels.

reservoir_covered.description_en: A covered reservoir is a large man-made tank for holding fresh water

satellite_dish.description_en: A dish-shaped parabolic antenna designed to receive or transmit radio waves to or from a satellite

sign.description_en: A permanent physical object displaying messages, like entrance sign of place or city, political sign, but otherwise not covered byadvertising=*,tourism=informationorhistoric=epigraph.

silo.description_en: A storage container for bulk material, often grains such as corn or wheat

snow_fence.description_en: A solid fence-like structure built across steep slopes to reduce risk and severity of (snow) avalanches.

spoil_heap.description_en: Spoil heap, piles of waste rock removed during mining.

spring_box.description_en: A structure designed for protecting and catching groundwater from a natural spring.

storage_tank.description_en: A container that holds liquids or compressed gases.

street_cabinet.description_en: A cabinet located in the street and hosting technical equipment to operate facilities such as electricity or street lights.

stupa.description_en: A Buddhist dome-shaped structure with a spire on top

surveillance.description_en: A surveillance camera or other type of surveillance equipment.

survey_point.description_en: A triangulation pillar, geodetic vertex, or other piece of fixed equipment used by topographers.

tailings_pond.description_en: Tailings pond: A body of liquid or slurry used to store byproducts of mining operations

telescope.description_en: Telescope: an instrument that aids in the observation of remote objects by collecting light or radio waves

threshing_floor.description_en: An open air paved area created to thresh the grain harvest and then winnow it.

torii.description_en: The gate structure found at the entrance of Shinto shrines and (rarely) Japanese Buddhist temples.

tower.description_en: A tower is a free-standing structure which is higher than it is wide. Addtower:type=*if possible.

trough.description_en: A long, narrow container, open on top, for feeding or watering animals. The water from a trough usually would not be considered drinkable, however, it may be filled from a pipe providing drinkable water.

utility_pole.description_en: A single pole supporting elevation of any of various and unspecified public utilities, such as power transmission, lighting or telephony.

ventilation_shaft.description_en: A vertical space in mines, tunnels, or buildings allowing stale air to leave the space underneath and/or fresh air to enter it.

video_wall.description_en: A digital screen, typically constructed out of smaller LED panels.

wastewater_plant.description_en: A wastewater plant is a facility used to treat wastewater or sewage.
wastewater_plant.description_fr: Usine de traitement des eaux usées
wastewater_plant.description_enriched: Station d'épuration. Traitement eaux usées, assainissement.

water_tap.description_en: Publicly usable water tap, providing access to water and usually equipped with a valve.

water_tower.description_en: Structure with a water tank at an altitude to increase pressure in water network

water_well.description_en: A structural facility to access ground water, created by digging or drilling.

water_works.description_en: A place where drinking water is found and applied to the local waterpipes network.

watermill.description_en: A mill driven by water power.

wildlife_crossing.description_en: Structure that allow animals to cross human barriers safely.

windmill.description_en: A traditional windmill, historically used to mill grain with wind power. Seepower=generatorin combination withgenerator:source=windfor modern wind turbines.

windpump.description_en: A device that pumps natural gas or water using the wind, typically mass produced.

works.description_en: A factory or industrial production plant.

wheelchair.description: This tag may be used to mark places or ways that are suitable to be used with a wheelchair and a person with a disability who uses another mobility device (like a walker). It should only be used if yo

internet_access.description: This tag is for indication that a map entity such as a building, a shop, restaurant, etc. offers internet access to the public, either as a paid service or even for free.

wlan.description_enriched: Wifi. Sans fil, connexion internet, hotspot.

smoking.description: smoking=*is used to describe whethersmokingis allowed or not in a facility or on a property. Primarily, this tag is used on hospitality related amenities such asamenity=restaurant,amenity=pub, ortouri

dedicated.description_en: The complete facility (restaurant, pub, etc.) is dedicated to smokers; E.g., as a smoker's club, Fumoir, or Raucherclub.

isolated.description_en: Smoking is prohibited and allowed in two different rooms which are separated effectively (e.g., walls and a door which is opened only as long as it is necessary to pass through)

no.description_en: Smoking is prohibited in the entire amenity or property, without exceptions. Useseparatedorisolatedif there are exceptions. Tagseparated;isolatedis also meaningful.

outside.description_en: Smoking is allowed on the property but only in outside areas.

separated.description_en: Smoking is permitted in a separated room or area, either two different areas of the same room, or in different rooms without having an effective separation to each other; e.g., there is a door which is not being closed immediately after a person has passed.

yes.description_en: Smoking is permitted in the entire amenity or property.

drive_through.description: drive_through=*- this key is used to indicate whether an amenity or shop offers drive-through (also known as drive-thru or drive up) service, it is possible to use it without leaving your vehicle. To

sport.description: Thesport=*tag is used to identify one or more sports which can be practised at, or are otherwise associated with, some feature. A list of sports is given below.

10pin.description_en: Ten-pin bowlingis a sport in which a player, or "bowler" rolls a bowling ball down a lane with the objective of scoring points by knocking down as many pins as possible. In Canada, the United States, United Kingdom and Australia, the game is commonly referred to as just "Bowling".Useful combination:

9pin.description_en: Nine-pin bowling(Also known askegelnin German)is a bowling game played primarily in Europe with only nine pins.Useful combination:amenity=bar;pub;restaurantandleisure=bowling_alleySee Also:sport=10pin;bowls;horseshoes

aikido.description_en: Aikidois a Japanese martial art by blending with the motion of the attacker and redirecting the force of the attack rather than opposing it head-on.Useful combination:amenity=dojoSee Also:sport=judo;taekwondo

american_football.description_en: American footballis a sport played by two teams of eleven players on a rectangular field with goalposts at each end.Useful combination:leisure=pitch;stadium;sports_centreSee Also:sport=rugby_league;rugby_union;soccer,orsport=australian_football;canadian_footballTheambiguoussport=footballtag is somet

archery.description_en: Archeryis the art, practice, or skill of propelling arrows with the use of a bow.Useful combination:leisure=pitch;stadium;sports_centre- Indicating thatArcheryis the sport the facility or area is intended for.See Also:sport=shooting;fencing
archery.description_enriched: Tir à l'arc. Flèches, cible, précision.

athletics.description_en: Track and fieldathletics is a collection of sports which combines various athletic contests based on the skills of running, jumping, and throwing.Track and fieldis often categorised under the umbrella sport of athletics, which also includes road running, cross country running, and race walking.Usefu

australian_football.description_en: Australian rules football, officially known asAustralian football, also calledfootball,footy,Aussie rules, orAFLis a sport played between two teams of eighteen players on the field of either an Australian football ground, a modified cricket field, or a similarly sized sports venue.Useful combination

badminton.description_en: Badmintonis a racquet sport played by singles or in teams of two, who take positions on opposite halves of a rectangular court (pitch) divided by a net. Players score points by striking a shuttlecock with their racquet so that it passes over the net.Useful combination:leisure=pitch;sports_centreSee

bandy.description_en: Bandyis a team winter sport played on ice, in which skaters use sticks to direct a ball into the opposing team's goal. The sport has common background with association football, ice hockey and field hockey. The bandy field is about the same size as a football pitch. It is played on ice like ice hock

base.description_en: BASE jumping, is an activity that employs an initially packed parachute to jump from fixed objects. "B.A.S.E." is an acronym that stands for four categories of fixed objects:buildings,antennas,spans, andearth. A more down to earth approach to parachuting.Useful combination:building=*,man_made=*,brid

biathlon.description_en: The biathlon is a winter sport that combines cross-country skiing and rifle shooting.

bobsleigh.description_en: Bobsleigh,Luge, orBobsledeis a winter sport in which teams of two or four make timed runs down narrow, twisting, banked, iced tracks in a gravity-powered sled.Useful combination:leisure=track;sports_centre,surface=*See Also:sport=toboggan,Piste Maps,Winter sports

This is meant to specify the type ofrelations.U

bowls.description_en: Bowlsorlawn bowlsis a sport in which the objective is to roll biased balls so that they stop close to a smaller ball called a "jack" or "kitty". boxing.description_en: Boxing(pugilism,prize fighting,the sweet scienceor in Greek pygmachia) is a combat sport played in a boxing ring in which two people engage in a contest of strength, speed, reflexes, endurance, and will, by throwing punches with gloved hands against each other.Useful combination:leisure=stadium;spor

bullfighting.description_en: Bullfighting, both on foot and on horseback, is a physical contest in which bulls are fought by humans.Useful combination:leisure=stadium;pitch

canadian_football.description_en: Canadian football(CFL) is a form of gridiron football played in Canada in which two teams of 12 players each compete for territorial control of a field of play called a pitch. In Canada, the termfootballmay refer to Canadian football and American football collectively, or either sport specifically,

canoe.description_en: CanoeandKayakare a narrow human-powered boats, primarily designed to be manually propelled by means of a paddle for the use of racing, whitewater canoeing, touring and camping, freestyle, and general recreation. The intended use of the canoe dictates its hull shape and construction material.Useful c

chess.description_en: Chessis a two-player strategy board game played on a chessboard.The intended use is for big chess-boards in the open air.Useful combination:leisure=pitchoramenity=tableSee Also:club=chess

cliff_diving.description_en: Non-competitive divingis jumping from a cliff or a rock into water. Such non-competitive diving can occur indoors and outdoors. Outdoor diving typically takes place from cliffs or other rock formations either into fresh or salt water. However, man-made diving platforms are sometimes constructed in p

climbing_adventure.description_en: Climbing Adventureoften called"Adventure Park","Ropes Courses","Climbing Adventure","Zip-line", or"Treetop Adventure", can be used for the recreational sport when people get mountain hiking accessories and try to climb, walk or otherwise move on prebuilt wires and other objects high above on the tre

cockfighting.description_enriched: Combat de coqs. Traditionnel, interdit France.

curling.description_en: Curlingis a sport in which players slide stones on a sheet of ice towards a target area which is segmented into four concentric rings. It is related tobowls,boulesandshuffleboard. Indicating that curling is the sport the facility is intended for.Useful combination:leisure=pitch;stadium;sports_centre

cycling.description_enriched: Cyclisme. Vélo, course, Tour de France.

diving.description_en: The Olympic discipline Diving.sport=scuba_divingis the means for "swimming under the water".

dog_agility.description_en: Dog agility is a dog sport in which a handler directs a dog through an obstacle course in a race for both time and accuracy.

dog_racing.description_en: Greyhound racingbeing the most common type of this sport. There are other sports that involves dog racing, such asDogsled,Dachshund,Dog scootering,Lure coursing, andSkijoringracing.Useful combination:leisure=track;stadium;sports_centre,surface=*See Also:sport=horse_racing

equestrian.description_en: Equestrianism/equestrian sportis a sport that is practised with the horse as a partner. Often associated internationally with show jumping and dressage, but also including other disciplines like eventing, endurance riding, horseball, reining, tent pegging, vaulting, polo, driving, rodeo and more (se

fencing.description_en: Fencingis the martial art of fighting with blades. The most common version of fencing today, also called olympic fencing or competitive fencing, is divided into three weapon categories: foil, sabre (spelled saber in the United States) and épée. Classical fencing uses the same three weapons, but appr

field_hockey.description_en: Field hockeyis a team sport of the hockey family. Players use sticks made out of wood or fiber glass to hit a round, hard, rubber like ball. The game can be played on a grass field or a turf field as well as an indoor board surface.Useful combination:leisure=pitch;sports_centre;stadiumSee Also:sport

five-a-side.description_en: A variation of soccer with only 5 persons per team on a smaller pitch

floorball.description_en: Floorball is a type of floor hockey with five players and a goalkeeper in each team.

four_square.description_en: A hand ball game played on a square court.

free_flying.description_en: Hang glidingand/orParaglidingthat is a foot launched aircraft, without motorisation. Paragliding/Hanggliding/... takeoff, landings, towing, etc. and related amenities and properties

hapkido.description_en: Hapkidois a dynamic and highly eclectic Korean martial art. hiking.description_en: Going for a long, vigorous walk, usually on trails or footpaths in the countryside.

hockey.description_enriched: Hockey. Crosse, palet, glace ou gazon.

horse_racing.description_en: Horse racingis an equestrian sport in which several horses simultaneously race against each other.

ice_hockey.description_en: Ice Hockeyis a team sport played on ice in which two teams of skaters use sticks to shoot a hard rubber hockey puck into their opponent's net to score points.Useful combination:leisure=ice_rink;stadium;sports_centreSee Also:sport=field_hockey;ice_skating

ice_skating.description_en: Ice skatingis a sport or pastime by moving on ice while using ice skates.Useful combination:leisure=ice_rink;sports_centre;pitchSee Also:sport=ice_hockey;roller_skatingThedisambiguoussport=skatingtag is sometimes confused with this one.

kickboxing.description_en: Kickboxing is a group of stand-up combat sports based on kicking and punching.

krachtbal.description_en: Team sport played with a heavy ball on a rectangular pitch, originating in West-Flanders, Belgium

laser_tag.description_en: Laser tag is a tag game played in an arena.

longbowl.description_en: The object of longbowl is to throw a ball with as few throws as possible over a defined distance on open areas (fields, meadows), public roads and paved paths.

martial_arts.description_en: Martial artsare codified systems and traditions of combat

miniature_golf.description_en: Miniature golf, also known as minigolf, mini-putt, crazy golf, or putt-putt, is an offshoot of the sport of golf focusing solely on the putting aspect of its parent game.

parachuting.description_en: Parachutingor skydiving take-off or landing site

paragliding.description_en: Paragliding. Paragliding take-off or landing site

parkour.description_en: Parkour is a training discipline using movement that developed from military obstacle course training.

pilates.description_en: Pilates is a physical fitness system developed in the early 20th century by Joseph Pilates.

pole_dance.description_en: Pole dance as kind of sport

racquet.description_en: Racquetball. Group name of sports that are played with a racquet

running.description_enriched: Course à pied. Jogging, marathon, trail.

soccer.description_en: Soccer. Association football, more commonly known as football or soccer, a team sport played between two teams of eleven players. Note: While called "football" (fussball, fotball, …) in many countries, and by the International Olympic Committee, it is best to tag it as "soccer" to avoid confusion wi

softball.description_en: A bat-and-ball game similar to baseball.

speedway.description_en: Motorcycle speedway, usually referred to as speedway, is a motorcycle sport involving four and sometimes up to six riders competing over four anti-clockwise laps of an oval circuit.

squash.description_en: Squash is a racket and ball sport played by two or four players in a four-walled court with a small, hollow rubber ball.

sumo.description_en: Sumo. A traditional martial arts of Japan.
