toboggan.description_en: Toboggan. public sledding run; see alsoPiste Maps(piste:type=sled, piste:difficulty=advanced, piste:lit=yes)

trampoline.description_en: Trampoline sport is a sport that is carried on large trampolines indoor or outdoors

ultimate.description_en: Ultimate, also known as ultimate frisbee, is a team sport played with a flying disc (frisbee).

wakeboarding.description_en: Wakeboarding is a water sport in which the rider, standing on a wakeboard, is towed behind a motorboat in order to perform aerial maneuvers.

water_polo.description_en: Water polo. It can happen in aleisure=swimming_poolor in a multi-purpose water body (s.a. a canal).

water_ski.description_en: Waterskiingeither on a cable ski course, or pulled by a boat. Requiresarea=yes/noon closed ways, to distinguish between closed-loop cables and areas.

building.description: The building tag is used to mark a given object as abuilding. In OpenStreetMap, a building is a man-made structure with a roof, standing more or less permanently in one place.

allotment_house.description_en: A small outbuilding for short visits in a allotment garden.

annexe.description_en: An annexe is a small self contained apartments, collages, or small residential building on the same property as the main residential unit.

apartments.description_en: A building arranged into individual dwellings, often on separate floors. May also have retail outlets on the ground floor.
apartments.description_enriched: Immeuble d'appartements. Logements collectifs, résidence, locataires, copropriété.

bakehouse.description_en: A building that was built as a bakehouse (i.e. for baking bread). Often used in conjunction with another nodeamenity=baking_ovenandoven=wood_fired.
bakehouse.description_enriched: Fournil, boulangerie artisanale. Four à pain, cuisson, baguettes.

bank.description_enriched: banque. argent, compte, crédit, retrait, virement

barn.description_en: An agricultural building that can be used for storage and as a covered workplace.
barn.description_enriched: Grange. Stocker foin, paille, récoltes, matériel agricole, tracteur.

barracks.description_en: Buildings built to house military personnel or laborers.

beach_hut.description_en: A small, usually wooden, and often brightly coloured cabin or shelter above the high tide mark on popular bathing beaches.

boathouse.description_en: A boathouse is a building used for the storage of boats.

bridge.description_en: A building used as a bridge (skyway). To map a gatehouse usebuilding=gatehouse. See alsobridge=yesforhighway=*.Don't use this tag just for marking bridges (their outlines). For such purposes useman_made=bridge.
bridge.description_enriched: Pont couvert, bâtiment sur pont. Passage couvert, architecture.

bungalow.description_en: A single-storey detached small house, Dacha.
bungalow.description_enriched: Bungalow, maison plain-pied. Vacances, camping, résidence de plain-pied.

bunker.description_en: A hardened military building. Also usemilitary=bunker.
bunker.description_enriched: Bunker, blockhaus. Abri militaire, béton armé, guerre, fortification.

cabin.description_en: Acabinis a small, roughly built house usually with a wood exterior and typically found in rural areas.
cabin.description_enriched: Cabane, chalet. Refuge montagne, petite maison bois, abri.

carport.description_en: Acarportis a covered structure used to offer limited protection to vehicles, primarily cars, from the elements. Unlike most structures a carport does not have four walls, and usually has one or two.
carport.description_enriched: Abri voiture ouvert. Garage sans murs, protection véhicule.

castle.description_en: A building constructed as a castle. Can be further specified withhistoric=castle+castle_type=*.

cathedral.description_en: A building that was built as a cathedral. Used in conjunction withamenity=place_of_worship,religion=*,denomination=*andlanduse=religiousfor the cathedral grounds where it is in current use.
cathedral.description_enriched: Cathédrale. Évêque, messe, architecture gothique, vitraux, tours.

chapel.description_en: A building that was built as a chapel. Used in conjunction withamenity=place_of_worship,religion=*,denomination=*andlanduse=religiousfor the chapel grounds where it is in current use.
chapel.description_enriched: Chapelle. Petite église, prière, recueillement, cérémonie intime.

church.description_en: A building that was built as a church. Used in conjunction withamenity=place_of_worship,religion=*,denomination=*andlanduse=religiousfor the church grounds where it is in current use.
church.description_enriched: Église. Messe, curé, clocher, paroisse, baptême, mariage religieux.

civic.description_en: A generic tag for a building created to house some civic amenity, for exampleamenity=community_centre,amenity=library,amenity=toilets,leisure=sports_centre,leisure=swimming_pool,amenity=townhalletc. Useamenity=*orleisure=*etc. to provide further details. Seebuilding=publicand more specific tags like
civic.description_enriched: Bâtiment civique. Mairie, salle des fêtes, équipement public.

clock_tower.description_en: Clock towers are very high towers, visible from its surroundings, usually in central parts of town and squares, housing a turret clock with one or more clock faces, most often four. They are freestanding structures but can also be adjoined or located on top of another building.

college.description_en: A college building. Useamenity=collegeon the whole college area to represent the college as an institution.
college.description_enriched: Bâtiment d'études supérieures. IUT, BTS, école, salles de cours.

commercial.description_en: A building for non-specific commercial activities, not necessarily an office building. Consider tagging the surrounding area usinglanduse=commercialif there is such use. Use 'retail' if the building consists primarily of shops.
commercial.description_enriched: Immeuble de bureaux et commerces. Entreprises, boutiques, centre d'affaires.

conservatory.description_en: A building or room having glass or tarpaulin roofing and walls used as an indoor garden or a sunroom (winter garden).
conservatory.description_enriched: Serre d'agrément, orangerie. Plantes exotiques, jardin d'hiver.

construction.description_en: Used for buildings under construction. Useconstruction=*to hold the value for the completed building.
construction.description_enriched: Chantier, bâtiment en construction. Travaux, grues, ouvriers.

container.description_en: For a container used as a permanent building.Do not map containers placed temporarily, for example used in shipping or construction.

cowshed.description_en: A cowshed (cow barn, cow house) is a building for housing cows, usually found on farms.
cowshed.description_enriched: Étable à vaches. Vaches laitières, traite, élevage bovin.

detached.description_en: A detached house, a free-standing residential building usually housing a single family.
detached.description_enriched: Maison individuelle isolée. Pavillon, villa, jardin, terrain.

digester.description_en: A digester is a bioreactor for the production of biogas from biomass.

dormitory.description_en: A shared building intended for college/university students (not a share room for multiple occupants as implied by the term in British English). Alternatively, use building=residential plusresidential=universityand loose the information that it is for students.
dormitory.description_enriched: Résidence universitaire, internat. Chambres étudiants, foyer, cité U.

farm.description_en: A residential building on a farm (farmhouse). For other buildings see belowbuilding=farm_auxiliary,building=barn, … If in your country farmhouse looks same as general residential house then you can tag asbuilding=houseas well. See alsolanduse=farmyardfor the surrounding area
farm.description_enriched: Ferme, corps de ferme. Exploitation agricole, agriculteur, basse-cour.

farm_auxiliary.description_en: A building on a farm that is not a dwelling (use 'farm' or 'house' for the farm house).
farm_auxiliary.description_enriched: Bâtiment annexe de ferme. Hangar, remise, stockage agricole.

fire_station.description_en: A building constructed as fire station, i.e. to house fire fighting equipment and officers, regardless of current use. Addamenity=fire_stationon the grounds for an active fire station.

garage.description_en: Agarageis a building suitable for the storage of one or possibly more motor vehicle or similar. Seebuilding=garagesfor larger shared buildings. For an aircraft garage, seebuilding=hangar.
garage.description_enriched: Garage. Garer voiture, atelier bricolage, stockage.

garages.description_en: A building that consists of a number of discrete storage spaces for different owners/tenants. See alsobuilding=garage.
garages.description_enriched: Boxes de garage. Garages collectifs, stationnement couvert.

garbage_shed.description_enriched: Local poubelles. Conteneurs ordures, tri sélectif, bacs.

gatehouse.description_en: An entry control point building, spanning over a highway that enters a city or compound.

ger.description_en: A permanent or seasonal round yurt or ger.
ger.description_enriched: Yourte mongole. Habitat nomade, tente ronde, feutre.

government.description_en: For government buildings in general, including municipal, provincial and divisional secretaries, government agencies and departments, town halls, (regional) parliaments and court houses.
government.description_enriched: Bâtiment administratif officiel. Préfecture, ministère, services État.

grandstand.description_en: The main stand, usually roofed, commanding the best view for spectators at racecourses or sports grounds.
grandstand.description_enriched: Tribune de stade. Gradins couverts, spectateurs, supporters.

greenhouse.description_en: Agreenhouseis a glass or plastic covered building used to grow plants. Uselanduse=greenhouse_horticulturefor an area containing multiple greenhouses
greenhouse.description_enriched: Serre agricole. Culture sous verre, tomates, légumes, chauffage.

hangar.description_en: Ahangaris a building used for the storage of airplanes, helicopters or space-craft. Consider addingaeroway=hangar, when appropriate.
hangar.description_enriched: Hangar d'aviation. Abri avions, maintenance aéronautique.

hospital.description_en: A building errected for a hospital. Useamenity=hospitalfor the hospital grounds.
hospital.description_enriched: Bâtiment d'hôpital. Soins, chambres patients, bloc opératoire.

hotel.description_en: A building designed with separate rooms available for overnight accommodation. Normally used in conjunction withtourism=hotelfor the hotel grounds including recreation areas and parking.
hotel.description_enriched: Hôtel. Chambres, réception, séjour, touristes, nuitées.

house.description_en: A dwelling unit inhabited by a single household (a family or small group sharing facilities such as a kitchen). Houses forming half of a semi-detached pair, or one of a row of terraced houses, should share at least two nodes with joined neighbours, thereby defining theparty wallbetween the propertie
house.description_enriched: Maison familiale. Habitation, foyer, domicile, logement.

houseboat.description_en: A boat used primarily as a home
houseboat.description_enriched: Péniche habitable. Vivre sur l'eau, bateau-logement.

hut.description_en: Ahutis a small and crude shelter. Note that this word hastwo meanings- it may be synonym ofbuilding=shed, it may be a residential building of low quality.
hut.description_enriched: Hutte, cabane primitive. Abri rustique, refuge basique.

industrial.description_en: A building for industrial purposes. Use warehouse if the purpose is known to be primarily for storage/distribution. Consider usinglanduse=industrialfor the surrounding area and appropriate tags likeman_made=worksto describe the industrial activity.
industrial.description_enriched: Usine, bâtiment industriel. Production, manufacture, entrepôt.

kindergarten.description_en: For any generic kindergarten buildings. Buildings for specific uses (sports halls etc.) should be tagged for their purpose. If there is currently a kindergarten in the building, useamenity=kindergartenon the perimeter of the kindergarten grounds.
kindergarten.description_enriched: Bâtiment de maternelle. École petits, crèche, jardin d'enfants.

kingdom_hall.description_en: A building that was built as aKingdom Hall. Often used in conjunction withamenity=place_of_worship,religion=christian,denomination=jehovahs_witnessandlanduse=religiousfor the grounds where it is in current use.

kiosk.description_enriched: Kiosque, édicule. Journaux, friandises, petite boutique.

kitchen.description_enriched: Cuisine collective. Cantine, préparation repas, restauration.

livestock.description_en: A building for housing/rising other livestock (apart from cows, horses or pigs covered above), or when the livestock changes.

mall.description_enriched: Centre commercial. Galerie marchande, boutiques, shopping.

military.description_enriched: Bâtiment militaire. Caserne, armée, défense, garnison.

monastery.description_en: A building constructed asmonastery. Often, monasteries consist of several distinct buildings with specific functions. For active monasteries (communities), useamenity=monastery, for the grounds of a former monastery, have a look athistoric=monastery
monastery.description_enriched: Monastère. Moines, vie monastique, prière, cloître, abbaye.

mosque.description_en: A building errected as mosque. Used in conjunction withamenity=place_of_worship,religion=*,denomination=*andlanduse=religiousfor the grounds where it is in current use.
mosque.description_enriched: Mosquée. Prière musulmane, imam, minaret, vendredi, ramadan.

museum.description_en: A building which was designed as a museum.

office.description_en: An office building. Useoffice=*where applicable for the business(es) that use the building. Consider tagging the surrounding area usinglanduse=commercialif it applies. Preferlanduse=retailif the building consists primarily of shops.
office.description_enriched: Immeuble de bureaux. Entreprises, open space, salles réunion.

outbuilding.description_en: A less important building near to and on the same piece of land as a larger building.

pagoda.description_en: A building constructed as a pagoda.

parking.description_enriched: Parking couvert. Stationnement voitures, places, étages.

pavilion.description_en: A sports pavilion usually with changing rooms, storage areas and possibly an space for functions & events. Avoid using this term for other structures called pavilions by architects (seePavilion)

presbytery.description_en: A building where priests live and work.

public.description_en: A building constructed as accessible to the general public (a town hall, police station, court house, etc.).
public.description_enriched: Bâtiment public. Services municipaux, accueil citoyens.

quonset_hut.description_en: A lightweight prefabricated structure in the shape of a semicircle.

religious.description_en: Unspecific building related to religion. Prefer more specific values if possible.
religious.description_enriched: Bâtiment religieux. Lieu de culte, prière, cérémonie.

residential.description_en: A general tag for a building used primarily for residential purposes. Where additional detail is available consider using 'apartments', 'terrace', 'house', 'detached' or 'semidetached_house'.

restaurant.description_enriched: restaurant. manger, dîner, déjeuner, repas, cuisine, table

retail.description_en: A building primarily used for selling goods that are sold to the public; useshop=*to identify the sort of goods sold or an appropriateamenity=*(pub, cafe, restaurant, etc.). Consider uselanduse=retailfor the surrounding area.
retail.description_enriched: Bâtiment commercial. Magasins, boutiques, vente au détail.

riding_hall.description_en: A building that was built as a riding hall.
riding_hall.description_enriched: Manège équestre. Équitation couverte, chevaux, cavaliers.

roof.description_en: A structure that consists of a roof with open sides, such as a rain shelter, and also gas stations
roof.description_enriched: Toiture seule, préau. Abri couvert sans murs, auvent.

ruins.description_en: Frequently used for a house or other building that is abandoned and in poor repair. However, some believe this usage is incorrect, and the tag should only be used for buildings constructed as fake ruins (for example sham ruins in an English landscape garden). See alsolifecycle tagging.
ruins.description_enriched: Ruines. Vestiges, bâtiment détruit, archéologie, patrimoine.

school.description_en: A building errected as school. Buildings for specific uses (sports halls etc.) should be tagged for their purpose. If there is currently a school, useamenity=schoolon the perimeter of the school grounds.
school.description_enriched: Bâtiment scolaire. Classes, cour de récréation, enseignement.

semidetached_house.description_en: A residential house that shares a common wall with another on one side. Typically called a "duplex" in American English.
semidetached_house.description_enriched: Maison jumelée. Deux maisons accolées, mitoyenneté.

service.description_en: Service building usually is a small unmanned building with certain machinery (like pumps or transformers).

shed.description_en: Ashedis a simple, single-storey structure that is used for storage, hobbies, or as a workshop.
shed.description_enriched: Remise, cabanon. Stockage outils, jardinage, abri léger.

ship.description_en: A decommissioned ship/submarine which stays in one place.

shop.description_enriched: Boutique, magasin. Commerce de détail, vente.

shrine.description_en: A building that was built as a shrine. Used in conjunction withamenity=place_of_worship,religion=*,denomination=*andlanduse=religiousfor the grounds where it is in current use. Small structures should considerhistoric=wayside_shrine.
shrine.description_enriched: Sanctuaire, oratoire. Petit lieu de culte, dévotion.

silo.description_en: A silo is a building for storing bulk materials
silo.description_enriched: Silo agricole. Stockage grain, céréales, alimentation bétail.

slurry_tank.description_en: A circular building built to hold a liquid mix of primarily animal excreta (also known as slurry).
slurry_tank.description_enriched: Fosse à lisier. Stockage déjections animales, élevage.

sports_centre.description_en: A building that was built as a sports centre.

sports_hall.description_en: A building that was built as a sports hall.
sports_hall.description_enriched: Gymnase. Basket, handball, sport en salle, compétitions.

stable.description_en: A building constructed as a stable for horses.
stable.description_enriched: Écurie. Chevaux, boxes, palefrenier, foin, équitation, poney.

stadium.description_en: A building constructed to be a stadium building, including buildings that are abandoned and used nowadays for a different purpose.
stadium.description_enriched: Stade. Matchs football, rugby, concerts, supporters, gradins, pelouse.

static_caravan.description_en: A mobile home (semi)permanently left on a single site
static_caravan.description_enriched: Mobil-home fixe. Camping, résidence secondaire, vacances.

stilt_house.description_en: A building raised on piles over the surface of the soil or a body of water

storage_tank.description_en: Storage tanks are containers that hold liquids
storage_tank.description_enriched: Réservoir, cuve. Stockage liquide, eau, carburant.

sty.description_en: Asty(pigsty, pig ark, pig-shed) is a building for raising domestic pigs, usually found on farms.

supermarket.description_en: A building constructed to house a self-service large-area store.

synagogue.description_en: A building that was built as a synagogue. Used in conjunction withamenity=place_of_worship,religion=*,denomination=*andlanduse=religiousfor the grounds where it is in current use.
synagogue.description_enriched: Synagogue. Culte juif, rabbin, Torah, shabbat.

tech_cab.description_en: This article or section containsquestionable, contentiousorcontroversial information. See thetalk pagefor more information.Overlaps with predominatebuilding=service+building:prefabricated=yesSmall prefabricated cabin structures for the air-conditioned accommodation of different technology.

temple.description_en: A building that was built as a temple. Used in conjunction withamenity=place_of_worship,religion=*,denomination=*andlanduse=religiousfor the grounds where it is in current use.
temple.description_enriched: Temple. Culte hindou, bouddhiste, prière, méditation.

tent.description_en: For a permanently placed tent.Do not map tents placed temporarily.

terrace.description_en: A single way used to define the outline of a linear row of residential dwellings, each of which normally has its own entrance, which form a terrace ("row-house" or "townhouse" in North American English). Consider defining each dwelling separately using 'house'.
terrace.description_enriched: Maisons mitoyennes en rangée. Habitations alignées, murs communs.

toilets.description_enriched: Bloc sanitaires. WC publics, toilettes extérieures.

tower.description_en: A tower-building. Best combined withtower:type=*. See alsoman_made=towerfor a tag with a similar definition.

train_station.description_en: A building constructed to be a train station building, including buildings that are abandoned and used nowadays for a different purpose.
train_station.description_enriched: Gare ferroviaire. Trains, quais, billets, voyageurs.

transformer_tower.description_en: A transformer tower is a characteristic tall building comprising a distribution transformer and constructed to connect directly to a medium voltage overhead power line. Quite often the power line has since been undergrounded but the building may still serve as a substation. If the building is still
transformer_tower.description_enriched: Poste de transformation. Électricité haute tension, EDF.

transportation.description_en: A building related to public transport. You will probably want to tag it with proper transport related tag as well, such aspublic_transport=station. Note that there is a special tag for train station buildings -building=train_station.
transportation.description_enriched: Gare, terminal transport. Bus, métro, voyageurs.

tree_house.description_en: An accommodation, often designed as a small hut, sometimes also as a room or small apartment. Built on tree posts or on a natural tree. A tree house has no contact with the ground. Access via ladders, stairs or bridgeways.

triumphal_arch.description_en: A free-standing monumental structure in the shape of an archway with one or more arched passageways.

trullo.description_en: A stone hut with a conical roof.
trullo.description_enriched: Trullo, maison conique. Architecture traditionnelle Pouilles.

university.description_en: A university building. Useamenity=universityfor the university as an institution.
university.description_enriched: Bâtiment universitaire. Fac, campus, amphis, recherche.

warehouse.description_en: A building primarily intended for the storage or goods or as part of a distribution system.
warehouse.description_enriched: Entrepôt, dépôt. Stockage marchandises, logistique, palettes.

water_tower.description_enriched: Château d'eau. Réservoir surélevé, distribution eau potable.

windmill.description_en: A building constructed as a traditional windmill, historically used to mill grain with wind power.

yes.description_en: Use this value where it is not possible to determine a more specific value.

landuse.description:
Mainly used to describe the primary use of land by humans.
For general information on mapping/classifying land areas seeLand use and areas of natural land. SeeLandcoverfor general information on taggi

allotments.description_en: A piece of land given over to local residents for growing vegetables and flowers.

animal_keeping.description_en: An area of land that is used to keep animals, particularly horses and livestock.

aquaculture.description_en: Aquacultureis the farming of freshwater and saltwater organisms such as finfish, molluscs, crustaceans and aquatic plants.Warning: currently, there is no convention on the exact meaning of this tag. Therefore, it makes sense to treat it like "boundary of aquaculture" (without implication of water bo

basin.description_en: An area artificially graded to hold water.Together withbasin=*for stormwater/rainwater infiltration/detention/retention basins.Other languages.
basin.description_enriched: Bassin de rétention. Eau pluie, inondation, stockage.

brownfield.description_en: Describes land scheduled for new development where old buildings have been demolished and cleared

cemetery.description_en: Place for burials. You can addreligion=*(values listed in theplace of worship page). Smaller places (e.g. with a church nearby) may useamenity=grave_yardinstead.

commercial.description_en: Predominantly commercial businesses and their offices. Commercial businesses which sell goods should be categorised aslanduse=retail. Commercial businesses can sell services on site and may include private Doctor's Surgeries, and those non-government services for mental and physical health, such as

conservation.description_en: Protected areas (deprecated) Alternate tagging of same thing:boundary=protected_area,protected_area=*

construction.description_en: A site which is under active development and construction of a building or structure, including any purposeful alteration to the land or vegetation upon it. Abandoned construction projects and sites should not use this tag.
construction.description_enriched: Zone en chantier. Travaux, construction, grues.

depot.description_en: An area used as a depot for e.g. vehicles (trains, buses or trams). Consider using rather standard landuse tags likelanduse=railway,landuse=commercial,landuse=industrial, with subtag likeindustrial=depot.

education.description_en: An area predominately used for educational purposes/facilities.

farmland.description_en: An area of farmland used for tillage (cereals, vegetables, oil plants, flowers).
farmland.description_enriched: Terres agricoles. Champs, cultures, céréales, blé.

farmyard.description_en: An area of land with farm buildings like farmhouse, dwellings, farmsteads, sheds, stables, barns, equipment sheds, feed bunkers, etc. plus the open space in between them and the shrubbery/trees around them.
farmyard.description_enriched: Cour de ferme. Bâtiments agricoles, tracteurs.

forest.description_en: Managed forest or woodland plantation (Other languages). Some use this to map an area of trees rather than the use of the land. SeeForest.

garages.description_en: One level buildings with boxes commonly for cars, usually made of brick and metal. Usually this area belong to garage cooperative with own name, chairman, budget, rules, security, etc.
garages.description_enriched: Zone de garages. Boxes, stationnement privé.

grass.description_en: An area of mown and managed grass not otherwise covered by a more specific tag. Some view this as not a landuse, see the main pagelanduse=grassfor discussion.
grass.description_enriched: Pelouse, gazon. Herbe entretenue, espaces verts.

greenery.description_en: Used for any area covered with landscaping or decorative greenery, regardless of it being on a roundabout, along a street or in a park/garden, This tag has been used for vegetation that is hard to classify, either because its kind or because its diversity.

greenfield.description_en: Describes land scheduled for new development where there have been no buildings before. A greenfield is scheduled to turn into a construction site
greenfield.description_enriched: Terrain vierge. Non construit, futur projet.

greenhouse_horticulture.description_en: Area used for growing plants in greenhouses

highway.description_en: Area of land used for a highway, including all auxiliary areas like associated footways, verges and ditches.

industrial.description_en: Predominantly industrial landuses such as workshops, factories, or warehouses.

institutional.description_en: Land used for institutional purposes, seeInstitution (disambiguation). Institutional land may contain one or more buildings like anoffice=government,office=ngo,office=association,amenity=social_facilityand their associated infrastructure (car parks, service roads, yards and so-on) inside the area.Th

logging.description_en: An area where some or all trees have been cut down

meadow.description_en: A meadow or pasture: land primarily vegetated by grass and non-woody plants, mainly used for hay or grazing
meadow.description_enriched: Prairie, pré. Herbe naturelle, pâturage, foin.

military.description_en: For land areas owned/used by the military for whatever purpose
military.description_enriched: Zone militaire. Armée, défense, interdit public.

orchard.description_en: intentional planting of trees or shrubs maintained for food production
orchard.description_enriched: Verger. Arbres fruitiers, pommes, poires, cerises.

plant_nursery.description_en: intentional planting of plants maintaining for the production of new plants

port.description_en: coastal industrial area where commercial traffic is handled. Consider usinglanduse=industrial+industrial=portfor this type of industrial area.

recreation_ground.description_en: An open green space for general recreation, which may include pitches, nets and so on, usually municipal but possibly also private to colleges or companies
recreation_ground.description_enriched: Terrain loisirs. Sport, jeux, espace vert.

religious.description_en: An area used for religious purposes

reservoir.description_en: Areservoiron Wikipedia. Deprecated variant ofnatural=water+water=reservoir. SeeProposed features/Reservoirfor details.

residential.description_en: Land where people reside; predominantly residential detached (single houses, grouped dwellings), or attached (apartments, flats, units) dwellings. For "Mixed-Use" areas where more than half of the land is residential, tag as residential.See also:Land use and areas of natural land#Open questionsandLa

retail.description_en: Predominantly retail businesses such as shops. Retail businesses sell physical goods such as food (prepared or grocery), clothing, medicine, stationary, appliances, tools, or other similar physical items. Retail businesses have high amounts of public foot traffic. Retail businesses do not exclusivel

salt_pond.description_en: A place where salt (saline) water is evaporated to extract its salt.

village_green.description_en: A village green is a distinctive area of grassy public land in a village centre. Not a generic tag for urban greenery. It is a typical English term – defined separately from 'common land' under the Commons Registration Act 1965 and the Commons Act 2006.

vineyard.description_en: A piece of land where grapes are grown.

winter_sports.description_en: An area dedicated to winter sports (e.g. skiing)

natural.description: Thenaturalkey is used to describe a wide variety of physical geography,geologicalandlandcoverfeatures, including ones that have beenmodified or created by humans.

arch.description_en: A rock arch naturally formed by erosion, with an opening underneath.

arete.description_en: Anarête, a thin, almost knife-like, ridge of rock which is typically formed when two glaciers erode parallel U-shaped valleys.
arete.description_enriched: Arête rocheuse. Crête montagne, ligne sommets.

bare_rock.description_en: An area with sparse/no soil or vegetation, so that the bedrock becomes visible.

bay.description_en: An area of water mostly surrounded by land but with a level connection to the ocean or a lake.
bay.description_enriched: Baie, anse. Échancrure côte, port naturel.

beach.description_en: landform along a body of water which consists of sand, shingle or other loose material
beach.description_enriched: Plage. Sable, galets, baignade, mer, bronzer.

blockfield.description_en: A surface covered with boulders or block-sized rocks, usually the result of volcanic activity or associated with alpine and subpolar climates and ice ages.

blowhole.description_en: An opening to a sea cave which has grown landwards resulting in blasts of water from the opening due to the wave action

cape.description_en: A piece of elevated land sticking out into the sea or large lake. Includes capes, heads, headlands and (water) promontories.
cape.description_enriched: Cap, pointe. Avancée terre mer, promontoire.

cave_entrance.description_en: The entrance to a cave: a natural underground space large enough for a human to enter.
cave_entrance.description_enriched: Entrée de grotte. Caverne, spéléologie, exploration.

cliff.description_en: A vertical or almost vertical natural drop in terrain, usually with a bare rock surface (leave the lower face to the right of theway).

coastline.description_en: Themean high water springsline between the sea and land (with the water on the right side of theway.)
coastline.description_enriched: Littoral. Côte, bord de mer, limite terre-eau.

crevasse.description_en: A large crack in a glacier

dune.description_en: A hill of sand formed by wind, covered with no or very little vegetation. See alsonatural=sandandnatural=beach

earth_bank.description_en: Large erosion gully or steep earth bank

fell.description_en: Habitat above the tree line covered with grass, dwarf shrubs and mosses.
fell.description_enriched: Alpage, lande altitude. Montagne herbeuse, pâturage.

fumarole.description_en: A fumarole is an opening in a planet's crust, which emits steam and gases

geyser.description_en: A spring characterized by intermittent discharge of water ejected turbulently and accompanied by steam.
geyser.description_enriched: Geyser. Eau chaude jaillissante, Islande, Yellowstone.

glacier.description_en: A permanent body of ice formed naturally from snow that is moving under its own weight.

grassland.description_en: Areas where the vegetation is dominated by grasses (Poaceae) and other herbaceous (non-woody) plants. For mown/managed grass seelanduse=grass, for hay/pasture seelanduse=meadow.

gully.description_en: Small scale cut in relief created by water erosion

heath.description_en: A dwarf-shrub habitat, characterised by open, low growing woody vegetation, often dominated by plants of the Ericaceae.Note. This is not for parks whose name contains the word "heath".

hot_spring.description_en: A spring of geothermally heated groundwater
hot_spring.description_enriched: Source chaude. Eau thermale naturelle, géothermie.

isthmus.description_en: A narrow strip of land, bordered by water on both sides and connecting two larger land masses.

moor.description_en: Don't use, see wikipage. Upland areas, characterised by low-growing vegetation on acidic soils.

mountain_range.description_enriched: Chaîne de montagnes. Alpes, Pyrénées, massif.

mud.description_en: Area covered with mud: water saturated fine grained soil without significant plant growth. Also seenatural=wetland+wetland=*.

peak.description_en: The top (summit) of a hill or mountain.

peninsula.description_en: A piece of land projecting into water from a larger land mass, nearly surrounded by water

reef.description_en: A feature (rock, sandbar, coral, etc) lying beneath the surface of the water

ridge.description_en: A mountain or hill linear landform with a continuous elevated crest

rock.description_en: A notable rock or group of rocks attached to the underlying bedrock.

saddle.description_en: The lowest point along a ridge or between two mountain tops
saddle.description_enriched: Col, selle. Passage entre deux sommets.

sand.description_en: An area covered by sand with no or very little vegetation. Seenatural=beachandnatural=duneas well.

scree.description_en: Unconsolidated angular rocks formed by rockfall and weathering from adjacent rockfaces.

scrub.description_en: Uncultivated land covered with shrubs, bushes or stunted trees.

shingle.description_en: An accumulation of rounded rock fragments on a beach or riverbed

shoal.description_en: An area of the sea floor near the sea surface (literally, becomes shallow) and exposed at low tide. Seenatural=sandas well.

shrubbery.description_en: An area of shrubbery that is actively maintained or pruned by humans. A slightly wilder look is also possible

sinkhole.description_en: A natural depression or hole in the surface topography.

spring.description_en: A place where ground water flows naturally from the ground (Other languages).

stone.description_en: A single notable freestanding rock, which may differ from the composition of the terrain it lies in.; e.g., glacial erratic.

strait.description_en: A narrow area of water surrounded by land on two sides and by water on two other sides.
strait.description_enriched: Détroit. Passage mer, bras de mer.

tree_stump.description_en: A tree stump, the remains of a cut down or broken tree.

tundra.description_en: Habitat above tree line in alpine and subpolar regions, principally covered with uncultivated grass, low growing shrubs and mosses and sometimes grazed.

valley.description_en: A natural depression flanked by ridges or ranges of mountains or hills

volcano.description_en: An opening exposed on the earth's surface where volcanic material is emitted.

water.description_en: Any body of water, from natural such as a lake or pond to artificial like moat or canal. Also seewater=river

wetland.description_en: A natural area subject to inundation or with waterlogged ground, further specified withwetland=*

wood.description_en: Tree-covered area (a 'forest' or 'wood'). Also seelanduse=forest. For more detail, one can useleaf_type=*andleaf_cycle=*.
wood.description_enriched: Bois naturel. Forêt sauvage, non exploitée.

highway.description: The keyhighway=*is the main key used for identifying any kind of road, street or path. The value of the key helps indicate the importance of the highway within the road network as a whole. See the tab

0-4.description_en: The IMBA Trail Difficulty Rating System shall be used for bikeparks. It is adapted to mtb trails with artificial obstacles.

0-5.description_en: A classification scheme for mtb trails for going uphill if there is significant inclination.

0-6.description_en: Applies tohighway=pathandhighway=track. A classification scheme for mtb trails (few inclination and downhill).

<place name of destination>.description_en: Destination when following a linear feature

Number % | ° | up | down.description_en: Incline steepness as percents ("5%") or degrees ("20°"). Positive/negative values indicate movement upward/downwards in the direction of the way.

Text.description_en: Applies tohighway=pathandhighway=track. A key to input variable infos related to mtbiking on a way with human words

both | left | right.description_en: A bus bay outside the main carriageway for boarding/alighting

both | left | right | no.description_en: Specifies that the highways has sidewalks on both sides, on one side or no sidewalk at all

bridleway.description_en: For horse riders. Pedestrians are usually also permitted, cyclists may be permitted depending on local rules/laws. Motor vehicles are forbidden.

bump | hump | table | island | cushion |.description_en: Features used to slow down traffic. SeeKey:traffic calmingfor more details.
bump | hump | table | island | cushion |.description_fr: Bump | Hump | Table | Island | Cushion | Yes | Etc.
bump | hump | table | island | cushion |.description_enriched: Bump | Hump | Table | Island | Cushion | Yes | Etc

bus_guideway.description_en: A busway where the vehicle guided by the way (though not a railway) and is not suitable for other traffic. Please note: this is not a normal bus lane, useaccess=no,psv=yesinstead! If the buses are not guided, considerhighway=busway.

bus_stop.description_en: A small bus stop. Optionally one may also usepublic_transport=stop_positionfor the position where the vehicle stops andpublic_transport=platformfor the place where passengers wait.
bus_stop.description_enriched: Arrêt de bus. Attendre bus, abribus, horaires.

busway.description_en: A dedicated roadway for bus rapid transit systems

commercial | industrial | mixed | reside.description_fr: Commercial | Industrial | Mixed | Residential | Retail Etc.
commercial | industrial | mixed | reside.description_enriched: Commercial | Industrial | Mixed | Residential | Retail Etc

construction.description_en: For roads under construction. Useconstruction=*to hold the value for the completed road.
construction.description_enriched: Route en travaux. Chantier, déviation, patience.

corridor.description_en: For a hallway inside of a building.

crossing.description_en: A.k.a. crosswalk. Pedestrians can cross a street here; e.g., zebra crossing

cycleway.description_en: For designated cycleways. Addfoot=*, though it may be avoided ifdefault-access-restrictionsdo apply.

cyclist_waiting_aid.description_en: Street furniture for cyclists that are intended to make waiting at esp. traffic lights more comfortable.

designated | yes_unposted | end.description_en: Specifying roads signposted as priority roads.

elevator.description_en: An elevator or lift, used to travel vertically, providing passenger and freight access between pathways at different floor levels.

emergency_access_point.description_en: Sign number which can be used to define your current position in case of an emergency. Use withref=NUMBER_ON_THE_SIGN. See alsoemergency=access_point

emergency_bay.description_en: An area beside a highway where you can safely stop your car in case of breakdown or emergency.

escape.description_en: For runaway truck ramps, runaway truck lanes, emergency escape ramps, or truck arrester beds. It enables vehicles with braking failure to safely stop.

excellent | good | intermediate | bad |.description_en: Applies totrailblazed=*. A classification for visibility of trailblazing. SeeKey:trailblazed:visibilityfor more information.
excellent | good | intermediate | bad |.description_fr: Excellent | Good | Intermediate | Bad | Horrible | No
excellent | good | intermediate | bad |.description_enriched: Excellent | Good | Intermediate | Bad | Horrible | No

excellent | good | intermediate | bad |.description_en: Specifies the physical usability of a way for wheeled vehicles due to surface regularity/flatness. SeeKey:smoothnessfor more details.
excellent | good | intermediate | bad |.description_fr: Excellent | Good | Intermediate | Bad | Very Bad | Horrible | Very Horrible | Impassable
excellent | good | intermediate | bad |.description_enriched: Excellent | Good | Intermediate | Bad | Very Bad | Horrible | Very Horrible | Impassable

footway.description_en: For designated footpaths; i.e., mainly/exclusively for pedestrians. This includes walking tracks and gravel paths. If bicycles are allowed as well, you can indicate this by adding abicycle=yestag. Should not be used for paths where the primary or intended usage is unknown. Usehighway=pedestrianfor p

forward | backward.description_en: Traffic priority for narrow parts of roads, e.g. narrow bridges.

free | ticket | disc | residents | custo.description_en: Deprecated variant to map parking conditions along streets. See section on street parking above or thestreet parkingpage for more details.
free | ticket | disc | residents | custo.description_fr: Free | Ticket | Disc | Residents | Customers | Private
free | ticket | disc | residents | custo.description_enriched: Free | Ticket | Disc | Residents | Customers | Private

grade1 | grade2 | grade3 | grade4 | grad.description_en: To describe the quality of the surface. SeeKey:tracktypefor more information.

hitchhiking.description_en: Like a bus_stop but for free, uncertain, spontaneous rides with strangers.

ladder.description_en: A vertical or inclined set of steps or rungs intended for climbing or descending of a person with the help of hands.

lane.description_en: Deprecated variant to tag bus lanes. Replaced by bus/psv lane tagginglanes:bus=*/lanes:psv=*) /bus:lanes=*/psv:lanes=*

lane | street_side | on_kerb | half_on_k.description_en: Primary key to record parking along the street. Describes the parking position of parked vehicles in the street.
lane | street_side | on_kerb | half_on_k.description_fr: Lane | Street Side | On Kerb | Half On Kerb | Shoulder | No | Separate | Yes
lane | street_side | on_kerb | half_on_k.description_enriched: Lane | Street Side | On Kerb | Half On Kerb | Shoulder | No | Separate | Yes

left | slight_left | through | right | s.description_en: The key turn can be used to specify the direction in which a way or a lane will lead.
left | slight_left | through | right | s.description_fr: Left | Slight Left | Through | Right | Slight Right | Merge To Left | Merge To Right | Reverse
left | slight_left | through | right | s.description_enriched: Left | Slight Left | Through | Right | Slight Right | Merge To Left | Merge To Right | Reverse

living_street.description_en: Forliving streets, which are residential streets where pedestrians have legal priority over cars, speeds are kept very low.
living_street.description_enriched: Zone de rencontre. Piétons prioritaires, 20 km/h.

mini_roundabout.description_en: Similar to roundabouts, but at the center there is either a painted circle or a fullytraversableisland. In case of an untraversable center island,junction=roundaboutshould be used.Rendered as anti-clockwise by defaultdirection=anticlockwise. To render clockwise add the tagdirection=clockwise.
mini_roundabout.description_enriched: Mini rond-point. Carrefour giratoire petit, céder passage.

motorway.description_en: A restricted access major divided highway, normally with 2 or more running lanes plus emergency hard shoulder. Equivalent to the Freeway, Autobahn, etc..
motorway.description_enriched: Autoroute. Péage, vitesse élevée, voies rapides.

motorway_junction.description_en: Indicates a junction (UK) or exit (US).ref=*should be set to the exit number or junction identifier. (Some roads – e.g., the A14 – also carry junction numbers, so the tag may be encountered elsewhere despite its name)

motorway_link.description_en: The link roads (sliproads/ramps) leading to/from a motorway from/to a motorway or lower class highway. Normally with the same motorway restrictions.
motorway_link.description_fr: Bretelle d'accès ou de sortie autoroutière

opposite.description_en: Deprecated variant for ways withoneway=yeswhere buses are legally permitted to travel in both directions. Replaced byoneway:bus=no

opposite_lane.description_en: Deprecated variant for ways withoneway=yesthat have a bus lane which go in the opposite direction to normal traffic flow (a "contraflow" bus lane). Replaced byoneway:bus=noandlanes:bus=*/lanes:psv=*) /bus:lanes=*/psv:lanes=*

opposite_share_busway.description_en: Deprecated variant for ways withoneway=yesthat have a bus lane that cyclists are also permitted to use, and which go in the opposite direction to normal traffic flow (a "contraflow" bus lane). Replaced byoneway:bicycle=no+cycleway:left=share_busway/cycleway:right=share_busway+cycleway:left:oneway=-1

opposite_track.description_en: Deprecated variant for ways withoneway=yesthat have a cycling track going the opposite direction of normal traffic flow. Replaced byoneway:bicycle=no+cycleway:left=track/cycleway:right=track+cycleway:left:oneway=-1/cycleway:right:oneway=-1.

parallel | diagonal | perpendicular.description_en: To specify the orientation of parked vehicles if there is street parking.

parallel | diagonal | perpendicular | ma.description_en: Deprecated variant to map parking along streets. See section on street parking above or thestreet parkingpage for more details.
parallel | diagonal | perpendicular | ma.description_fr: Parallel | Diagonal | Perpendicular | Marked | No Parking | No Stopping | Fire Lane.
parallel | diagonal | perpendicular | ma.description_enriched: Parallel | Diagonal | Perpendicular | Marked | No Parking | No Stopping | Fire Lane

passing_place.description_en: The location of a passing space
passing_place.description_enriched: Place de croisement. Route étroite, évitement.

path.description_en: A non-specific path. Usehighway=footwayfor paths mainly for walkers,highway=cyclewayfor one also usable by cyclists,highway=bridlewayfor ones available to horse riders as well as walkers andhighway=trackfor ones which is passable by agriculture or similar vehicles.

paved | unpaved | asphalt | concrete | p.description_fr: Paved | Unpaved | Asphalt | Concrete | Paving Stones | Sett | Cobblestone | Metal | Wood | Compacted | Fine Gravel | Gravel | Pebblestone | Plastic | Grass Paver | Grass | Dirt | Earth | Mud | Sand | Ground
paved | unpaved | asphalt | concrete | p.description_enriched: Paved | Unpaved | Asphalt | Concrete | Paving Stones | Sett | Cobblestone | Metal | Wood | Compacted | Fine Gravel | Gravel | Pebblestone | Plastic | Grass Paver | Grass | Dirt | Earth | Mud | Sand | Ground

pedestrian.description_en: For roads used mainly/exclusively for pedestrians in shopping and some residential areas which may allow access by motorised vehicles only for very limited periods of the day. To create a 'square' or 'plaza' create a closed way and tag as pedestrian and also witharea=yes.
pedestrian.description_enriched: Zone piétonne. Centre-ville, shopping, sans voitures.

phone.description_en: A calling device can be used to tell on your current position in case of an emergency. Use withref=NUMBER_ON_THE_SIGN

platform.description_en: A platform at a bus stop or station.
platform.description_enriched: Quai arrêt. Bus, tram, montée, attente.

primary.description_en: The next most important roads in a country's system. (Often link larger towns.)

primary_link.description_en: The link roads (sliproads/ramps) leading to/from a primary road from/to a primary road or lower class highway.
primary_link.description_fr: Voie d'accès à une route primaire

proposed.description_en: For planned roads, use withproposed=*and a value of the proposed highway value.

raceway.description_en: A course or track for (motor) racing

residential.description_en: Roads which serve as an access to housing, without function of connecting settlements. Often lined with housing.

rest_area.description_en: Place where drivers can leave the road to rest, but not refuel.

road.description_en: A road/way/street/motorway/etc. ofunknowntype. It can stand for anything ranging from a footpath to a motorway. This tag should only be used temporarily until the road/way/etc. has been properly surveyed. If youdoknow the road type, donotuse this value, instead use one of the more specifichighway=*v
road.description_enriched: Route type inconnu. Non classifiée, à vérifier.

roundabout.description_en: This automatically impliesoneway=yes, the oneway direction is defined by the sequential ordering of nodes within the Way. This applies on a way, tagged withhighway=*already.
roundabout.description_enriched: Rond-point. Giratoire, céder passage, sens unique.

secondary.description_en: The next most important roads in a country's system. (Often link towns.)

secondary_link.description_en: The link roads (sliproads/ramps) leading to/from a secondary road from/to a secondary road or lower class highway.

service.description_en: For access roads to, or within an industrial estate, camp site, business park, car park, alleys, etc. Can be used in conjunction withservice=*to indicate the type of usage and withaccess=*to indicate who can use it and in what circumstances.
service.description_enriched: Voie de desserte. Parking, station, accès arrière.

services.description_en: A service station to get food and eat something, often found at motorways
services.description_enriched: Aire de services. Autoroute, essence, restaurant, repos.

share_busway.description_en: There is a bus lane that cyclists are permitted to use.

shared_lane.description_en: Cyclists share a lane with motor vehicles, there are markings reminding about this. In some places these markings are known as "sharrows" ('sharing arrows') and this is the tag to use for those.

sidewalk.description_en: Sidewalk that runs typically along residential road. Use in combination withhighway=footwayorhighway=path

speed_camera.description_en: A fixed road-side or overhead speed camera.

speed_display.description_en: A dynamic electronic sign that displays the speed of the passer-by motorist.

steps.description_en: For flights of steps (stairs) on footways. Use withstep_count=*to indicate the number of steps

street_lamp.description_en: A street light, lamppost, street lamp, light standard, or lamp standard is a raised source of light on the edge of a road, which is turned on or lit at a certain time every night

strolling | hiking | mountain_hiking | d.description_en: Applies tohighway=pathandhighway=footway. A classification scheme for hiking trails.
strolling | hiking | mountain_hiking | d.description_fr: Strolling | Hiking | Mountain Hiking | Demanding Mountain Hiking | Alpine Hiking | Demanding Alpine Hiking | Difficult Alpine Hiking
strolling | hiking | mountain_hiking | d.description_enriched: Strolling | Hiking | Mountain Hiking | Demanding Mountain Hiking | Alpine Hiking | Demanding Alpine Hiking | Difficult Alpine Hiking

tertiary.description_en: The next most important roads in a country's system. (Often link smaller towns and villages)

tertiary_link.description_en: The link roads (sliproads/ramps) leading to/from a tertiary road from/to a tertiary road or lower class highway.

toll_gantry.description_en: A toll gantry is a gantry suspended over a way, usually a motorway, as part of a system of electronic toll collection. For a toll booth with any kind of barrier or booth see:barrier=toll_booth

track.description_en: A track provides a route that is separated from traffic. In the United States, this term is often used to refer to bike lanes that are separated from lanes for cars by pavement buffers, bollards, parking lanes, and curbs.Notethat a cycle track may alternatively be drawn as a separate way next to the
track.description_enriched: Chemin rural. Terre, tracteur, forêt, agriculture.

traffic_island.description_en: The way between two crossings, safespot for pedestrians, has micromapping characteristics as a detailed alternative to=*. Use in combination withhighway=footwayorhighway=path.

traffic_mirror.description_en: Mirror that reflects the traffic on one road when direct view is blocked.

trailhead.description_en: Designated place to start on a trail or route

trunk.description_en: The most important roads in a country's system that aren't motorways. (Need not necessarily be a divided highway.)

trunk_link.description_en: The link roads (sliproads/ramps) leading to/from a trunk road from/to a trunk road or lower class highway.
trunk_link.description_fr: Voie d'accès à une voie rapide/express

turning_circle.description_en: A turning circle is a rounded, widened area usually, but not necessarily, at the end of a road to facilitate easier turning of a vehicle. Also known as acul de sac.

turning_loop.description_en: A widened area of a highway with a non-traversable island for turning around, often circular and at the end of a road.

unclassified.description_en: The least important through roads in a country's system – i.e. minor roads of a lower classification than tertiary, but which serve a purpose other than access to properties. (Often link villages and hamlets.)The word 'unclassified' is a historical artefact of the UK road system and doesnotmean that
unclassified.description_enriched: Route non classée. Locale, petite route.

via_ferrata.description_en: A via ferrata is a route equipped with fixed cables, stemples, ladders, and bridges in order to increase ease and security for climbers. These via ferrata require equipment : climbing harness, shock absorber and two short lengths of rope, but do not require a long rope as for climbing.
via_ferrata.description_enriched: Via ferrata. Escalade équipée, câbles, échelles, montagne.

yes.description_en: A highway functions during winter, probably can't be driven in summer.

yes | <type of railway>.description_en: A highway on which non-railway traffic is also allowed has railway tracks embedded in it but the rails are mapped as separate ways.

yes | dyke.description_en: A dyke or a raised bank to carry a road, railway, or canal across a low-lying or wet area.

yes | no.description_en: A paving in the ground to be followed with a blindman's stick.

yes | no |.description_en: Used on ways withoneway=yeswhere it is legally permitted to cycle in both directions.

yes | no | caution | both | forward | ba.description_en: Specifying sections of roads where overtaking is legally forbidden. Useovertaking:forward=yes/no/cautionandovertaking:backward=yes/no/cautionwhen it depends on driving direction.
yes | no | caution | both | forward | ba.description_fr: Yes | No | Caution | Both | Forward | Backward
yes | no | caution | both | forward | ba.description_enriched: Yes | No | Caution | Both | Forward | Backward

yes | no | not_right | not_left | only_r.description_fr: Yes | No | Not Right | Not Left | Only Right | Only Left
yes | no | not_right | not_left | only_r.description_enriched: Yes | No | Not Right | Not Left | Only Right | Only Left

yes | no | poles | cairns | symbols.description_en: Applies tohighway=*. Describing trail blazing and marking. SeeKey:trailblazedfor more information.

yes | no | reversible.description_en: Oneway streets are streets where you are only allowed to drive in one direction.

railway.description: railway=*is used to tag rails and infrastructure for many kinds ofrailwaysincluding light rail, mainline freight and industrial railways,metros, monorails andtrams.

<number>.description_en: The voltage with which a line is electrified. Also see the frequency tag.

<number> [Hz].description_en: The frequency with which a line is electrified. Use 0 for DC. Also see the voltage tag.

abandoned.description_en: The course of a former railway which has been abandoned andthe track removed. The course is still recognized through embankments, cuttings, tree rows, bridges, tunnels, remaining track ties, building shapes and rolling or straight ways. Demolished rails that are no longer identifiable are better map

buffer_stop.description_en: Stops the train at the end of a track. Seebuffer stop.

contact_linerailyesno.description_en: contact_line: a power line over the train headrail: a third rail near the track supplying the train with poweryes: electrified track, but no details availableno: track with no power supply.

crossing.description_en: A point where pedestrians may cross.
crossing.description_enriched: Passage à niveau piéton. Traversée rails.

crossover.description_en: Relatively short lengths of track which switch traffic from one parallel line to another

depot.description_en: A rail yard used to store and deploy passenger rail cars. It should be added as a area on a landuse=railway.

derail.description_en: A device used to prevent fouling of a rail track by unauthorized movements of trains or unattended rolling stock. SeeDerail (railroad).

disused.description_en: A section of railway which is no longer used but where the track and infrastructure remains in place. The track is likely overgrown with endemic vegetation, but could be brought back into useful service with only minor effort.

funicular.description_en: Cable driven inclined railways on a steep slope, with a pair of cars connected by one cable

level_crossing.description_en: A point where rails and roads cross.
level_crossing.description_enriched: Passage à niveau. Route, barrières, train.

light_rail.description_en: A higher-standard tram system, normally in its own right-of-way. Often it connects towns and thus reaches a considerable length (tens of kilometres).

mainbranchindustrialmilitarytourismscien.description_en: main line: heavy trafficbranch line: connecting places with a mainlineindustrial: servicing large plants (iron, chemical etc.), surface mining, …military: servicing military areatourism: most mountain rails (rack-rails, funicular) and preserved railwaysscientific: rail transport at spaceports, large

miniature.description_en: Miniature railwaysare narrower than narrow gauge and carry passengers, frequently at an exact scale of "standard-sized" rail (for example "1/4 scale"). They can often be found in parks.

monorail.description_en: A railway with only a single rail. A monorail can run above the rail like in Las Vegas andDisneylandor can suspend below the rail like theWuppertal Schwebebahn(Germany).

narrow_gauge.description_en: Narrow-gauge passenger or freight train tracks. Narrow gauge railways can have mainline railway service like theRhaetian Railwayin Switzerland or can be a small light industrial railway. Usegauge=*to specify the actual width of rails in mm.

platform.description_en: This is parallel to the rail line for showing where the actual platforms are. It is also to know where you can change platform and enter the station, so use footpaths to connect them. This is really useful for routing too. Use in addition topublic_transport=platform.
platform.description_enriched: Quai de gare. Attendre train, embarquer.

preserved.description_en: This is the old tag for historic trains. Userailway:preserved=yesfor historical railway instead.

proposed.description_en: Railway being proposed but haven't started construction. Please see theproposedpage regarding verifiability on the ground of this value.

rail.description_en: Full sized passenger or freight train tracks in the standard gauge for the country or state.

railway.description_en: Ground used around railways and railwaystations.

roundhouse.description_en: A semicircular building with many stalls for servicing engines.

siding.description_en: Relatively short lengths of track, running parallel to (and connected to) a main route

spur.description_en: Relatively short lengths of track, built to give one company or entity access to a main or branch line.

station.description_en: Railwaypassenger and/or cargostation. Use in addition topublic_transport=station.

stop.description_en: Marks the position where trains stop at a station. It should be added as a node on a railway=rail way.

stop_position.description_en: The position on the railway track where the train (its centre) stops at a platform. This is useful for routing on long platforms where also short trains stop and on long platforms where multiple trains stop behind each other. See alsopublic_transport=stop_area.

subway.description_en: A city passenger rail service running mostly grade separated (seeWikipedia:rapid transit). Often a significant portion of the line or its system/network is underground.

subway_entrance.description_en: The entrance to a subway station, usually going from surface to underground.

tram.description_en: One or two carriage rail vehicle tracks, usually sharing motor road, sometimes called "street running" (Other languages).

tram_level_crossing.description_en: A point where trams and roads cross.

tram_stop.description_en: A tram stop is a place where a passenger can embark / disembark a tram.

traverser.description_en: These are used for changing trains between railways. Also known as transfer table.

turntable.description_en: These are used for changing the direction that part of a train is pointing in.

ventilation_shaft.description_en: A structure that allows ventilation in underground tunnels

water_crane.description_en: A structure to deliver water to steam locomotives

workshop.description_en: Repair shop' for (rail) rolling stock' is a place where maintenance or overhaul of these vehicles (rail vehicles, metro, tram, light rail, monorail) is carried out. It should be added as a area on a building=yes.

yard.description_en: Tracks within railway company operated marshalling or maintenance yards.

yes.description_en: If the railway goes below ground. Most subways have this tag.

yes / <type of railway>.description_en: Specifies that a highway on which non-railway traffic is also allowed has railway tracks embedded in it but the rails are mapped as separate ways.

aeroway.description: aeroway=*is atop-level tagfor physical infrastructure supporting aircraft and spacecraft travel. For further details on how to create aeroway features and how they are presented, seeAeroways.

aerodrome.description_en: Aerodromein the United Kingdom orAirportin North America is used to map the main area details (other thanhelicopters only).
aerodrome.description_enriched: Aéroport, aérodrome. Prendre l'avion, départ, arrivée, vols, check-in, embarquement.

airstrip.description_en: A field or area where light aircraft can land and take off from.
airstrip.description_enriched: Piste d'atterrissage sommaire. Terrain aviation léger, ULM, avions de tourisme.

apron.description_en: Airport apronis an area where planes are parked, unloaded or loaded, refuelled, or boarded.

beacon.description_en: Radio navigation aidis used to mark systems that determine a position on the Earth which helps pilots guide their aircraft during flight.

control_center.description_en: Control center(in the US referred to as air route traffic control center (ARTCC)) is a facility responsible for controlling aircraft en route in a particular volume of airspace (a Flight Information Region) at high altitudes between airport approaches and departures.

gate.description_en: Airport gateis used to mark the gate numbers at the airports where passengers wait before boarding their flight.

hangar.description_en: Hangaris a structure to hold aircraft or spacecraft.

helipad.description_en: Helipadis used to mark the landing area or platform for Helicopters

heliport.description_en: Heliportis used to map the main area details for helicopters.
heliport.description_enriched: Héliport, aire d'hélicoptère. Hélico, secours, SAMU, transport VIP.

highway_strip.description_en: Highway stripis a designated landing strip that is normally used as a part of a highway, but is closed for aeroplane landing either because of a military exercise or an emergency.

holding_position.description_en: A point behind which aircraft are considered clear of a crossing way

model_runway.description_en: Take-off and landing runway for model aircraft

navigationaid.description_en: A facility thatsupports visual navigation for aircraft

parking_position.description_en: A location where an aeroplane can park

runway.description_en: Runwayis a rectangular area in which aerodrome are prepared for the landing and takeoff of aircraft.
runway.description_enriched: Piste de décollage et atterrissage. Tarmac, bande d'envol, avions.

spaceport.description_en: A spaceport or cosmodrome: a site for launching or receiving spacecraft

stopway.description_en: Stopwayis a rectangular surface beyond the end of a runway used during an aborted takeoff.

taxilane.description_en: Taxilaneis a path in an airport that is part of the aircraft parking area or apron (Proposedfeature with low usage as of 2015-10; use with an eye towards the question correct usage).

taxiway.description_en: Taxiwayis a path on an airport connecting runways with ramps, hangars, terminals and other facilities.
taxiway.description_enriched: Voie de circulation aéroport. Chemin entre piste et terminal, roulage avion.

terminal.description_en: Airport terminalis a building at an airport where passengers transfer between ground transportation and the facilities that allow them to board and disembark from aircraft.

tower.description_en: Control toweris a tall, windowed structure located on the airport grounds.See alsoaeroway=control_toweror combination ofman_made=tower+service=aircraft_controlfor similar schemes.

windsock.description_en: Windsockis designed to indicate wind direction and relative wind speed.

barrier.description: Abarrieris a physical structure which blocks or impedes movement. The barrier tag only covers on-the-ground barriers. It does not cover typical waterway barriers (dams, waterfalls, etc.). However, bar

bar.description_enriched: bar. alcool, bière, cocktail, soirée, apéro

city_wall.description_enriched: Rempart médiéval. Fortification, muraille historique, enceinte de ville.

fence.description_enriched: Clôture, grillage. Délimitation terrain, propriété, grille, palissade.

hedge.description_enriched: Haie vive. Arbustes, séparation végétale, bocage, thuyas.

kerb.description_enriched: Bordure de trottoir. Marche, caniveau, bord de chaussée, accessibilité.

retaining_wall.description_enriched: Mur de soutènement. Retenir la terre, talus, terrasse, dénivelé.

wall.description_enriched: Mur, muraille. Séparation en dur, pierre, béton, brique.

public_transport.description: Thepublic_transportkey denotes stop positions and platforms of public transport. Stop position are placed as node on the street. Platforms are placed next to the street. Both are members of the relati

stop_position.description_enriched: Position arrêt. Où s'arrête le véhicule.

place.description: Used to indicate that a particular location is known by a particular name, to indicate what sort of "place" it is. A place tag should exist for every significant human settlement (city, town, suburb,

boundary.description: boundary=*specifies the nature of aboundary relation, which describes the extent of an administrative, nature conservation, or otherwise demarcated area. Occasionally the tag is used on linear ways to

(date).description_en: Useful if the boundary is very recent (or if it will become effective in a near future).

(number).description_en: Used by some mappers instead ofadmin_level=*in conjunction withboundary=religious_administrationand is usually in the range 1 to 10.

aboriginal_lands.description_en: A boundary representing official reservation boundaries of recognized aboriginal / indigenous / native peoples.

administrative.description_en: An administrative boundary. Subdivisions of areas/territories/jurisdictions recognised by governments or other organisations for administrative purposes. These range from large groups of nation states right down to small administrative districts and suburbs, as indicated by theadmin_level=*combo tag

border_zone.description_en: A border zone is an area near the border where special restrictions on movement apply. Usually a permit is required for visiting.

census.description_en: A census-designated boundary delineating a statistical area, not necessarily observable on the ground.

disputed.description_en: An area of landed claimed by two or more parties (use with caution). See alsoDisputed territories.

forest.description_en: A delimited forest is a land which is predominantly wooded and which is, for this reason, given defined boundaries. It may cover different tree stands, non-wooded areas, highways… but all the area within the boundaries are considered and managed as a single forest.

forest_compartment.description_en: A forest compartment is a numbered sub-division within a delimited forest, physically materialized with visible, typically cleared, boundaries.

hazard.description_en: A designated hazardous area, with a potential source of damage to health, life, property, or any other interest of value.

health.description_en: Health division boundaries. Some mappers usehealth_level=*instead ofadmin_level=*to specify level in the health system hierarchy.

limited_traffic_zone.description_en: Describes an officially designated area that requires authorization for the entry of certain vehicles.

local_authority.description_en: Describes the territory of a local authority.

low_emission_zone.description_en: A geographically defined area which seeks to restrict or deter access by certain polluting vehicles with the aim of improving the air quality.

maritime.description_en: Maritime boundaries which are not administrative boundaries: the Baseline, Contiguous Zone and EEZ (Exclusive Economic Zone).

marker.description_en: A boundary marker, border marker, boundary stone, or border stone is a robust physical marker that identifies the start of a land boundary or the change in a boundary, especially a change in direction of a boundary. See alsohistoric=boundary_stone

national_park.description_en: Area of outstanding natural beauty, set aside for conservation and for recreation (Other languages).

place.description_en: boundary=placeis commonly used to map the boundaries of aplace=*, when these boundaries can be defined but these are not administrative boundaries.

postal_code.description_en: Postal code boundaries. Some mappers usepostal_code_level=*instead ofadmin_level=*to specify level in the postal hierarchy.

protected_area.description_en: Protected areas, such as for national parks, marine protection areas, heritage sites, wilderness, cultural assets and similar.

public_transport.description_en: An operating area of a transit authority.

religious_administration.description_en: A religious administration boundary, eg. of a catholic diocese or parish. Usereligion=*anddenomination=*to specify the church to which the boundary applies. Some mappers usereligious_level=*instead ofadmin_level=*to specify level in the church hierarchy.

special_economic_zone.description_en: A government-defined area in which business and trade laws are different.

statistical.description_en: An official boundary recognised by government for statistical purposes.

military.description: Tags with the military key are used for buildings and land used by the Army, Navy, Air Force and any other kind of military or paramilitary service in the host country (seemilitary_service=*). There's

airfield.description_enriched: Base aérienne. Avions militaires, armée de l'air.

naval_base.description_enriched: Base navale. Marine, bateaux guerre, port.

nuclear_explosion_site.description_enriched: Site explosion nucléaire. Test atomique, historique.

range.description_enriched: Champ de tir. Entraînement, armes, cibles.

power.description: This key is used to identify a wide range of facilities and features that relate to the generation and distribution of electrical power including power lines, power generation, pylons and sub-stations

pole.description_fr: Pylône électrique à un seul pied

route.description: This key is be used to describe a route: a customary or regular line of passage or travel, often predetermined and publicized. Routes consist of paths taken repeatedly by people and vehicles: a ship o
